loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 63 years old and widowed with seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Loreta is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Loreta has been in the pig-fattening business for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 67 years old, married and has six children. Francisca owns and operates a business planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living. Francisca has been involved in her business for 33 years and earns 30,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2004, Francisca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Francisca is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 53 years old, married and has nine children, two of whom are in school.

Avelina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Avelina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Avelina has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Avelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 47 years old, and married. She is currently residing in the village of Sta. Luciana. Zenaida has been selling vegetables in their village for almost two years; through this business she's earning an income of PHP 200 per day. 

She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase vegetables to sell such as eggplants, squash, string beans, and tomatoes. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can utilize her loan for her business and to become profitable.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell such as eggplants, squash, string beans, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Doña Juana continua con su único medio de ingresos la venta de tortillas, frijoles cocidos para el cual pasa casi todo el día exponiendose al calor del fuego y el humo de la leña haciendo las tortillas, mientras su esposo labora también para aportar en los gastos de la casa y de esa manera sacan adelante a sus hijos quienes cada día van creciendo y cursando su año escolar, este cuarto crédito que solicita es para lograr terminar de construir el muro de su casa para vivir en mejores condiciones y garantizar la seguridad de sus hijos.
texts.en: Juana still has only one source of income - selling tortillas and cooked beans.  She is exposed to the heat of the fire and the wood smoke all day as she makes her tortillas.  Meanwhile, her husband also works to contribute to the household expenses and, in this way, they support their children who are growing every day and are enrolled in school.  This loan, the fourth she has applied for, will be used to finish building a wall in her home so as to improve her family's living conditions and ensure her sons' safety.

loans.use: to buy breezeblocks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is now 34 years old and her four children are still doing well in school.

Lucy used her previous loan well as she was able to get a good harvest and made lots of profits. She has now applied for her fourth loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy maize seedlings, fertilizers and also pay for labor in this new planting season. She is optimistic that her farm will do better after the loan.

She hopes to work and diversify into dairy farming in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell on her food stall.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new vehicle repair kit.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda works hard to support her two children. 

Leonarda requested a PHP 1,800 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours even after nightfall.

Leonarda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Shoniso

texts.en:
Shoniso is married and has four children who are 25, 16, 10 and five years old. She always wanted to provide them with a good education. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Shoniso decided to start a new business of animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

She studied on the course ‘To Get Ahead’ provided by a women’s organization and got sufficient business skills. Her children will help her with her business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. 

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy cattle to set up the new business. She will get by using her loan, and her business will go on to be a source of income, so that her family will have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle so as to set up a new business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 48-yearl-old married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen buys and sells livestock in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.
Helen has been in this business for 5 years. Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Cistina

texts.en:
Cistina is 24 years old, married with two children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail business which is selling cosmetics in the local community. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. 

She joined in GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as lotion and soap. Her hopes and dreams in life are to have a better future and to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as lotion and soap.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 55 and has four children. He started operating a transportation business 10 years ago. This source of income is sending his children to school, so Rolando really dedicates himself to his work. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy new tires and other spare parts that he needs to maintain in his tricycle. In the future, he wants to see his children finishing their studies through his occupation and his sacrifices.

loans.use: to buy new tires and other spare parts.

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is requesting a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) to stock up on inventory items such as used shoes to sell. She has been selling such items for three years in the city’s market. Usually, such markets were built by the municipality, so that Romans & Egyptians could sell there, and now almost every major city has one.
Lindita is a 43-year-old Egyptian lady. She is married and has two children. Her children are ten and seven years old and all of them live in a main city in southern Albania in an Egyptian community.
Kindly note, that Lindita has been photographed at her home with her oldest son, Mathew, because she was too shy to have her photo taken in public.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to re-sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal/firewood retail business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.
Amelita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.
NWTF is re-listing Amelita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is involved in farming together with her husband. She is 27 years old, from the village of Carmencita in the province of Isabela. She is very diligent person, she always make sure that she provides the needs of her family. She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. She hopes that someday she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 34 years old, married with two children. With two children currently in school, Jennifer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store like noodles, sugar, soft-drinks, bread, etc.

Jennifer has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sugar, soft-drinks, bread, etc. 

Jennifer would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store like noodles, sugar, soft-drinks and bread.

loans.name: Kholod

texts.en:
Kholod is a 26-year-old married woman. She is employed in natural treatment center and her husband is a taxi driver. Their income is not enough to cover all their needs.

Kholod wants to improve her home living conditions so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing air conditioning. Taking this loan will offer Kholod and her husband a new air conditioning unit and will allow them to enjoy fresh hot and cold air in all seasons in their house.

Kholod and her husband have a good reputation among their friends and their clients.

Kholod appears in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase air conditioning for her house.

loans.name: Nica

texts.en:
Nica is 51 years old, married and has three children. Nica engages in the selling of school and office supplies in the market while her husband is her companion in managing their business.
Nica uses the profits from the business and invests them in their farming business. Their retail business is their source of income that provides for their needs. Nica wants to have more stock of items to sell in able to minimize her expenses in marketing the items she has available. Hence, she is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy assorted items of school and office supplies. She hopes to increase her income to invest in her farming.

loans.use: to buy assorted items of school and office supplies.

loans.name: Jeimy Catherin

texts.es:
Ella es Jeimy tiene 18 años actualmente estudia mercadeo y ventas en Campoalto está cursando segundo semestre 
Siempre ha querido salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida por eso desde los 15 años empezó a trabajar en una casa de familia donde conocían a su mama y le dieron la oportunidad de poder trabajar en un horario de 3:00 a 7:00 pm luego se destaco mucho y la recomendaron con unos familiares de ellos donde también le ofrecieron empleo en el horario de la mañana fueron personas muy buena gente y gracias a ellos   pudo ahorrar   durante un año y medio para poder estudiar una carrera técnica  luego quiso cambiar de trabajo porque empezó  a estudiar y no podía cumplir con el horario así que vendió chorizos en carnicerías y restaurantes siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y poder obtener sus propias cosas,  aunque su familia la ha apoyado  mucho en lo que ha podido y siempre han querido que ella tenga más oportunidades de las que ellos tuvieron 

Quiere poder terminar su carrera técnica en campo alto para poder conseguir un mejor puesto laboral  para así poder seguir estudiando y terminar su carrera profesional en marketing y publicidad y así ayudar a su hermana menor, para que cuando termine sus estudios de bachiller pueda estudiar una carrera universitaria y que solo se dedique a estudiar 

También ha pensado más adelante poder montar su propia tienda de ropa interior y así poder aplicar todos los conocimientos adquiridos y crear empleo al menos a una persona 
También quiere aprender a hablar idiomas y así poder tener la oportunidad de  viajar a otros países y tal vez conseguir un trabajo y un mejor nivel de vida para su familia
texts.en:
Jeimy, 18, is currently studying her second semester of marketing and sales at CampoAlto. She has always wanted to succeed and to be someone in her life, so she started to work at the age of 15 in a family home, where they knew her mother and gave her the opportunity to work from 3pm to 7pm. She really stood out and they recommended her to their relatives, who also offered her work in the mornings. They were very good people, and thanks to them she was able to save up for a year and a half so that she could take on a technical degree.

Afterwards, she decided to change jobs because she started studying and she could no longer comply with her work schedule, so she sold chorizo in butcher's shops and restaurants. She has always liked being independent and obtaining her own things, even though her family has supported her as much as they could and they have always wanted her to have more opportunities than they had.

She wants to finish her program at CampoAlto so that she can obtain a better job position in order to continue studying and finish her professional degree in marketing and advertising. This will allow her to help her younger sister, so that she can study a university degree when she finishes high school and dedicate herself solely to her studies.

She has also thought about opening her own lingerie store in the future, where she will be able to apply all of the knowledge which she has acquired and to create employment for at least one person. She would also like to learn languages and thus have the opportunity to travel to other countries, perhaps finding a job and obtaining a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to finish her CampoAlto program in Marketing and Sales.

loans.name: Bichiko

texts.en:
Bichiko is 59 years old. He lives in the small village of Khulo District with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Bichiko requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of their low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have three milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, they have 0.5 hectares of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested products and cheese at local markets. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Bichiko requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of new a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Bichiko will purchase a car. After purchasing a car, he will be able to serve local people as a taxi driver and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car to work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina de 43 años, esta casada con Abdon con quien tiene una hija de 19 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo agrícola.Delfina se dedica a la agricultura desde los 19 años. Junto a su esposo, ha conseguido muchas satisfacciones con esta actividad, “gracias  a la agricultura tengo mi casa y terrenos propios”, menciona. Ella se encarga de producir arvejas, maíz, papas, alfalfa y flores de gladiolos , por la variedad de sus sembríos siempre está ocupada y siempre tiene ventas e ingresos para su familia. Estos meses son cruciales para las siembras de todo tipo, ya que las lluvias empezaron y Delfina no se quiere quedar atrás, por eso solicita de su apoyo para sembrar arvejas, habas y papas, cuyas cosechas estarán listas para febrero del año próximo.Delfina, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos , además agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .
texts.en:
Delfina, 43, is married to Abdon, with whom she has a 19-year-old daughter. They live in their own house, located in an agricultural settlement. 

Delfina has worked in agriculture since the age of 19. Alongside her husband, she has been very satisfied with this business activity. "Thanks to agriculture, I have my house and my own land," she says. She is responsible for producing peas, corn, potatoes, alfalfa, and gladiolus flowers. Due to the variety of her crops, she is always busy and she always has sales and an income for her family. 

These months are crucial for all types of crops, because the rains have started and Delfina does not want to fall behind. Therefore, she is asking for your help to plant peas, beans, and potatoes, whose harvests will be ready in February of next year. 

Delfina will invest these 3,000 Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops. She is also grateful for the financial support which she is receiving, and she is committed to paying her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is 36 years old, married with one child. With one child currently in school, Ma. Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like snack foods, noodles, bread, soft-drinks, laundry soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

Ma. Lorena has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, bread, soft-drinks, laundry soap, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like snack foods, noodles, bread, soft-drinks, laundry soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is 58 years old and lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. He is married and has three children, all of whom are still attending school. For the last two years, Hai has been buying and selling garbage in his village. The current business earns him about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.
This is the first microloan for him with VisionFund. Now he is applying for a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR. With this loan, he is going to buy more garbage to resell. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from his current business so as to make a living better and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy more garbage to resell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a basket weaving business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy supplies for her basket weaving.
Fe successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business.
NWTF is re-listing Fe's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en: Cristeta is a married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She earns a living through her food vending business selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her neighborhood. Cristeta is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like sugar, bananas, flour, sweet potatoes, and cooking oil. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Cristeta hopes of making her business more successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, bananas, flour, sweet potatoes, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Falconeri

texts.en:
Falconeri is 53 years old and is married with two children.

Falconeri works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Falconeri has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Falconeri aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is from the village of Carmencita. He is very hardworking father. He needs to maintain his business so that he can provide the needs of his family, most especially in financial terms. For that reason, he is asking a loan amounting PHP 21,000 to buy farm supplies for his farming business. Joseph hopes to expand his business so that he can improve his family’s quality of living.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 57 years old, married, and she and her husband are blessed with eight children. She's been selling vegetables in their village for almost 10 years, earning a net income of PHP 2,500 a month. 

She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase vegetables to sell such squash, string beans, cabbage and eggplants. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve her business further.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell such squash, string beans, cabbage and eggplants.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Khorn is 56 years old and widowed. She has nine children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice on one-hectare of farmland for thirty years. The current business earns her about 38,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Khorn’s group consists of five female members who live in the same village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is a first cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Khorn will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make her life better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 47 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock. In the future, Monina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a responsible housewife who supports her husband in satisfying their necessities and financing the education of their four children. To generate income, she is engaged in the cooking and selling of snacks and meals in the community. She aims to make the business profitable in order to generate a higher income. 

She plans to cook and sell different kinds of recipes but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to buy vegetables, pork, fish, dressed chicken and seasonings to be cooked and sold in the local community. She believes that the loan will be a great help to her in making an improvement in her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, pork, fish, dressed chicken and seasonings to be cooked and sold.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store, like biscuits, soap, candies, snack foods and other groceries. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store, like biscuits, soap, candies, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a Palestinian married man who is a father to three sons and two daughters, all of whom are school students. Jamal is a worker who gets a low income that is barely enough to cover the family's needs and the education costs.

Jamal wants to complete building his house, so he is requesting a 2,500 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing bricks (cement blocks). Taking this loan will allow Jamal to complete building his house, which will offer the family suitable home conditions so they can enjoy living in their house.

Jamal appears in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more bricks to complete building the house.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 41 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, candies, etc. to sell in her general store.

Milagros has borrowed and paid 3 loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an additional income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, candies, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George, 52 years old with three children, is a diligent and loving person. He manages a farm where his family gets their daily needs. He is asking for a loan of Php 20,000 to buy farm supplies for his farm business. George hopes that his business expands in the future so that he can sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for his farm business.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, San is aged 60 years old and widowed. She has nine children. She earns a living through farming rice, raising cows and working for others for a fee. Having been in these businesses for 10 years, San is able to earn approximately 32,000 KHR per day to support her family.
 
This is the second loan for San with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loan which has enabled her to relieve her family’s financial burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. San wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland, and she will use a portion of it on labor costs. She hopes to make a better crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business, which is planting and harvesting vegetables to sell. She has been in her business for over 6 years and earns about 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Her hopes and dreams in life are to have a better future and improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a 61-year-old married woman from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol.  She earns a living through her food vending business where she sells home-cooked snack foods.  Flora needs a loan for her business to buy additional food ingredients such as flour, glutinous rice, sugar, and milk.  With this, she will be able to cook more food to sell.  Flora hopes of improving her business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for their needs and daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy flour, glutinous rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San, 33, lives in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang Province and he is married with three children, all of whom are still in school. The family's main sources of income are from rice farming and cows raising. To add more income, he also runs a business as a motorcycle repairer in a local area. The current business earns his family about 24,000 KHR per day, of which he is able to save about 13,000 KHR each day after offsetting his daily expenses.  

San has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the loans, which has helped him to relieve family's burden and improve their livelihood. To support his business, he is now leading his group to apply for another loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He will use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland; he will also use a portion of it to pay for labor and land plowing. With this loan, he hopes to expand his rice field so as to make a better living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Kudaverdi

texts.en:
Khudaverdi is 51 years old. He lives in a small village in the Marneuli District with his wife, two sons and a daughter-in-law. Khudaverdi requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business startup, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 0.3 hectares of agricultural land where potatoes are grown. They sell the harvested potatoes at local markets. Kudaverdi’s son, Akhmed, has rented a workshop and works as an artisan of cars. It is hardly enough to pay for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Khudaverdi requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Khudaverdi will purchase a workshop where his son will get orders to repair cars. He wouldn’t have to pay rent, and this will increase the income of the family.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a workshop for his son to repair cars.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 60 years old and married with three children.  She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.  Lilia requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer.  Lilia has been farming vegetables for 18 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetables garden.

loans.name: Kimsan's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Sangke district, Kimsan is a 28-year-old mother of two children.  The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming, which she has been doing for 10 years.  To supplement the income, her husband also works for others for a fee.  With her current business, she can earn about 22,000 KHR per day to spend on daily expenses.  

This is the first loan for Kimsan’s group, a group of 3 women.  As the leader, Kimsan will use her portion to pay for plowing the rice field.  She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for plowing her rice field.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria sigue con su misma actividad de agricultura, sembrando variedad de vegetales, hortalizas y frutas, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de semilla para la siembra de Sandia y para el preparado de la tierra,  cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que las Sandias lo vendió en el mercado de la localidad, directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Victoria continues with the same business activity of farming.  She is growing a variety of fruits and vegetables.

She is now requesting the loan to buy seeds to plant watermelon and to prepare the land.

She says that it went very well for her with the loan because she sold the watermelons in the local market directly from producer to consumer.

loans.use: to sow watermelon.

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Majd is a 26-year-old married man. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen.

To earn a living, he has been running a stationery and a small call center for a year and a half. Majd is a person who has gone through many difficulties in his life. However, he has the determination to work and get ahead to continue making progress in life. He started his business with very little capital, but he was committed to being independent by starting up his own business. He works hard to generate the necessary income to cover his family's expenses.

Currently, Majd has requested a youth loan in the amount of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy stationary materials and accessories in order to diversify the products he offers for his customers. By doing so, he hopes that his business will increase its sales considerably.

loans.use: to purchase additional stationary materials and accessories in order to increase the variety of products he offers for his customers.

loans.name: Alda

texts.en:
Alda is a 51-year-old, married woman with two children. She lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, she owns and operates an agriculture business: she plants and harvests vegetables for sale in the local community. She has been in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP every month from these activities.

She joined GDMPC in 2009, and now she has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer (e.g., manure)

loans.name: Choern's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Sangke district of Cambodia, Choern is a 53-year-old widow. She is a hard-working farmer who earns a living by farming rice. To generate more income to better support her family, she also works as a paid worker. She has been in these businesses for ten years. She can earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day through her work to meet her family’s living expenses.

Choern has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loan cycles. She successfully paid back her prior loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund have helped her business by enabling her to expand her rice field.

Now she is leading a group seeking a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to plow her rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her business and to generate more income so as to make for better living conditions.

loans.use: To plow her rice field

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 45-year-old, married woman from the village of Carmencita of Isabela. She is a simple woman in the community. She and her husband have three children.

She is engaged in the farming business. She and her husband work together to maintain their business.

Editha is seeking a loan in the amount of 21,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow more crops. She hopes that her business will expand so that she can better provide for her children.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Perfil Martha
Costura 
600.000

 Martha es una mujer joven, madre de 2 hijos y con 2 años y medio de casada, junto a su esposo, están sacando adelante a la familia y tiene 3 años de estar dedicados a las labores de manufactura de ropa y otros. Su deseo principal es contar con capital para poder crecer y cubrir otros clientes que no han podido atender. Viven en un apartamento humilde, en la casa de la mamá de ella y desean salir adelante para realizarse como familia. Ella se ha capacitado pero se le han negado las puertas del crédito en los bancos, por la carencia de garantías solidas. Mujer esforzada, se ha capacitado en gestión empresarial y diseño, esto lo aplica al manejo de su negocio.

 En un trabajo que tuvo ahorra y compra sus máquinas, luego con el negocio han adquirido otra máquina de coser y una cortadora industrial, que les ayuda a mejorar la presentación de sus productos. Tienen un mercado consolidado y por la falta de capital deben trabajar de contado. Ya que tiene pedidos semanales. Atienden en Sarchi, Puntarenas, Palmares y asisten todas las semanas a un mercado en Grecia.

El nivel actual de trabajo le permite cubrir sus necesidades básicas y comprar mercadería, de acuerdo al estudio realizado cuentan con la capacidad de poder cubrir este préstamo ya que tiene clientes fijos y el aporte de capital les va a permitir comprar telas y una cosa muy importante, mejorar las condiciones en que trabajan.


Cuentan con equipo y un mercado que les da trabajo durante todo el año, su producción es de buena calidad ya que Martha es diseñadora, y tratan por todos los medios, y debido  la falta de capital, de sacar el máximo provecho de los insumos comprados. Han perdido oportunidades ya que no pueden dar crédito, debido a que con lo que cobran deben invertir de nuevo.  Además las condiciones de infraestructura en que trabajan no son las adecuadas, ya que prácticamente están a la intemperie, con este préstamo espera mejorar estas condiciones.
texts.en:
Martha is a young woman with two children.  She has been married for two and a half years, and she and her husband are getting their family ahead together.  She has been making clothes and other things for three years.  Her main wish is to have the capital to be able to grow and to cover other customers whom she has not been able to attend to.

They live in a humble apartment in her mother’s house.  They want to get ahead in order to fulfill themselves as a family.  She has been trained, but the doors to a loan at the banks have been closed to her due to the lack of solid guarantees.  

She is a hard-working woman, and she has trained in business administration and design.  She applies this to her business.

She had savings from a job, and she bought her machines.  Then they got another sewing machine and an industrial cutter.  These help her with the appearance of her products.  They have a consolidated market.  Due to lack of capital, they need to work for cash because she has weekly orders.  They take care of customers in Sarchi, Puntarenas, and Palmares.  They go to the market in Grecia every week.

Her current work level allows her to cover her basic needs and to buy merchandise.  According to the completed study, they have the capacity to be able to cover this loan.  This is because she has fixed customers.  The help from the loan will allow her to buy fabrics.  It will also allow something very important, the improvement of the conditions under which she works.

They have equipment and a market that gives them work all year.  Her production is good quality because Martha is a designer.  They try by all means, due to the lack of capital, to get the most from the purchased supplies.

They have lost opportunities because they are not able to get a loan.  This is because with what they charge, they need to invest again.  Also, the condition of the infrastructure in which they work is inadequate.  They are practically out in the open, and with this loan she hopes to improve these conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make clothes and underwear for men, women, and children.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
Nan is a 49-year-old, married woman. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband have ten children, one of whom is still in school.

To earn a living, she has been in the rice farming business for ten years. She explains that she earns approximately 13,000 KHR per day.

Nan’s group consists of two members, both females. She has been with VisionFund for five cycles. Nan successfully used the first loan to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion of the requested loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and she would like to use a portion of the loan proceeds to cover labor costs. Nan hopes to increase her crop yield and to earn more income so that she can improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her farmland and to cover labor costs

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is from Oni District, West Georgia. He lives with his wife and three children. Mamuka requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have a hectare of agricultural land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. Besides, they have 2 pigs. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Mamuka requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program seeks to provide business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit ,Mamuka will open a bakery. He will purchase all the equipment needed to bake bread, and building materials to build a bakery. After the bakery is built, Mamuka and his wife will bake bread and sell it locally. This will increase the income of the family. This new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a bakery and purchase all the equipment needed to bake bread.

loans.name: Jovillo

texts.en: Jovillo, 47 years old, has three school-aged children. A very jolly and loving father, he managed a farm for ten years. In order to provide for the needs of his family, he needs to work hard. He is asking a loan of Php 20,000 to buy farm inputs for his business. In the future, Jovillo hopes he can renovate their house to have a good quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for his business

loans.name: Zumratoy

texts.en:
Zumratoy is an honest person who is married and has five children. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than four years. Little by little, with the passing of time, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to the animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. Many of her customers are local butchers who are glad for her work. Her husband helps her with business. 
Last season, Zumratoy had more expenses and that’s why she does not have money to buy food products for her family. Her children, during some weeks, ask her to buy food items. She is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to buy food items. Zumratoy and her children await your support.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Dèmè Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques, les dix  femmes du groupe Dèmè ont en moyenne 47 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Gachi dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente du lait de vache, des céréales (mil, fonio)  d’arachide et du couscous.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Minata (femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de lait de vache de toutes sortes (lait frais, caillé et du yaourt) dans le village de Gachi. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 250 litres de lait  en gros avec les éleveurs du village et des villages environnants. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle mixte. Madame Minata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer le ravitaillement du foyer en condiments. Elle a pour objectif de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants avec l’épargne constituée dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The majority of the ten women of Dèmè Group are married and live in polygamous families. They average 47 years of age and 4 children.

The all live in Gachi, in Ségou Region (4th administrative region of Mali) and got acquainted through bonds of neighborhood, kinship, and marriage.

The buy and sell cow milk, cereals (millet, fonio), peanuts, and couscous.

Eager to bolster their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their second solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Minata (second women sitting from the left in the photograph) is a big seller of all sorts of cow milk (fresh milk, curd, and yoghurt) in Gachi.

She intends to use her loan to buy 250 liters of milk wholesale from dairy farmers in Gachi and in the surrounding villages. She resells at her home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele.

With this loan, Mrs. Minata hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 40), to be reinvested in her business and ensure food supplies to her household.

Her goal is to breed small ruminants with the money she was able to put away thanks to this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy fresh cow milk

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
This loan will help Dominic continue to provide handcrafted and quality teas to his local community.

Dominic has always loved sipping a high quality tea. Ten years ago, he decided to turn this passion into a reality, and he began his own business, Tea Chai Té, a casual tea house that specializes in handcrafted organic tea blends. Dominic began his company out of the desire to provide a product that is healthy for everyone involved—from the tea pickers overseas to the consumer in his local Portland community.

While Tea Chai Té began as a class project in college, Dominic now manages two store-front locations, employs 12 and ships nationwide. The entrepreneur hopes to hire one more employee with the help of this loan, and to eventually expand his company and build locations across the West Coast, from California to British Colombia. He also hopes to expand his eco-friendly wholesale products in an effort to reach out to more clients on a national level.

Read more about Dominic’s business at his website: http://www.teachaite.com/

Dominic needs a loan to purchase warehouse equipment in order to keep up with the high demand from his clients.

loans.use: to purchase warehouse equipment.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a business raising livestock in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. Nenita is borrowing 12000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family and purchase a motorcycle for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 25 years old. He lives in Kutaisi, West Georgia with his wife and father. George requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

George’s father is an artisan. He works on private orders on construction and house renovations to get small monthly salary. This is the only income for the family, and it is not enough to cover monthly expenses.

George requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program seeks to provide business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, George will purchase a digital camera. He will go on the weddings as an photographer, take pictures and edit them. George is very talented in taking pictures and people in his district know about it, so he will have many clients. As he will not have many expenses, George will make a good profit from this business. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a digital camera.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Sr. David  tiene 21 años,  el   se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa, yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Pacay,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. David  trabajo junto a su hermano Elías que es también cliente de la institución, ambos son agricultores, va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de papa y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, El Sr. David  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la su calidad de vida El Sr. David  es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señor David is 21 and makes a living in agriculture by planting a variety of vegetables as well as potatoes, yucca, and corn in his plot of land in the community of Pacay.  This loan is his first cycle with the institution.  Señor David works with his brother Elías who is also a customer of the institution.  Both are farmers.  He is going to use this loan to plant corn, which involves the preparation of the earth.  His reason for applying for this loan is to obtain resources for planting and to be able to survive.  

Señor David faces challenges in his business, like inclement weather, which on many occasions ruins his plants.  He will use the profits to improve the quality of his life.  Señor David is a responsible and hard-working person who feels grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is in her fifties, is married, and has one child. Rosalia manages a sari-sari store business in their village. Her husband is a farmer who is her partner in sustaining their family needs and their child's needs in school. 
Rosalia wishes that her store will become a grocery someday. She is striving and managing the business well to attain her wish. Rosalia needs additional capital to pursue her wish. Thus, she is requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy drinks, canned goods, snack foods and sugar to sell. She hopes for the growth of her business to become a big grocery soon.

loans.use: to buy drinks, canned goods, snack foods and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Afouchata

texts.fr:
Née en Août 1987  à Sikasso, Madame Afouchata est une femme mariée et mère de 3 enfants qui reside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula Ville Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Cette femme après mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès s’est initiée  aux activités d’achat et de vente de pagnes et d’encens il y’a environ 7 ans. 
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a environ trois ans. Après un prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel, les précédents étant correctement remboursés.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
Ce quatrième prêt lui permettra d’acheter 15 balles de pagnes et 20 boites d’encens à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) et sur place à Sikasso qui seront vendus de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afouchata was born in August 1987 in Sikasso. She's married and the mother of three children, and lives with her husband and their children in a large extended traditional family in Bougoula in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After running a lot of unsuccessful businesses, she started buying and selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) and frankincense approximately seven years ago.

Three years ago, eager to better meet an ever-increasing customer demand, she decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso.

After a solidarity loan (group loan) with a women's association in her neighborhood, she's now seeking her fourth personal loan. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

This fourth loan will enable her to buy 15 bales of pagnes and 20 boxes of frankincense in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) and in Sikasso. She will resell these products as a traveling saleswoman, to a clientele comprising mostly women.

With this loan, she foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 60'000 (ca US$ 120), to be used to bolster her working capital, help cover  expenses of her family, and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy 15 bales of pagnes (colorful African cloth) and 20 boxes of frankincense

loans.name: Temuraly

texts.en: Temuraly is married and has four children. He is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life to his children. Temuraly began his own business in animal husbandry when his children were little. He lives far from the center of his region and needs more money for improving his living conditions as there are a lot of problems with electricity and transport. He must develop his business and maximize profits. His income is not enough to buy cattle to increase the number he owns. He requested a loan in the amount of 1100 USD to increase the number of animals he has for sale. He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve his family's income.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 66 years old and comes from Kutaisi District. Tina is provided with a retirement pension. She requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays, she is without a source of income, except her small pension, which is in total 110 Laris (GEL) per month. 

Tina requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received loan, Tina will begin a business selling clothing. She plans to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and then resell it with a price mark-up among her villagers. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of Tina.

loans.use: to begin a business selling clothing

loans.name: Regalada

texts.en:
Regalada is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Regalada is 61 years old and has one child who is in school.

Regalada has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Regalada requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more fish to sell.

Regalada has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Regalada would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 38 years old. He lives in Chokhatauri district with his 32 year-old wife, his retired parents, and two children who are going to school.  Besik requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
Besik has a mini-bus. He works on the village bus line and transports local people. His monthly income is very small and not enough to feed the family.
Besik requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan programs envisage the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor.  These people do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Besik wants to open a car service center. He will purchase all the needed equipment and will do the work himself, as he is very experienced in this field. He is also well known among his villagers and will have a good number of clients. This will give him a good profit. He will reinvest part of the profit to develop his business, and another part will be used for covering family monthly expenses. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To open a car service centre

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 38-year-old married woman and mother of four children from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has been engaged in a furniture-making business together with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income.

Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy additional  materials for furniture-making like plywood, nails, varnish and others. With this, she will be able to improve their business thus augmenting their income. In the future, Zenaida has hopes of making her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional  materials for furniture making like plywood, nails, varnish and others

loans.name: Lucy W.

texts.en: Lucy is a mother of four children; two are in primary school and two are at the elementary level. She resides near the 14 Falls in Thika. She is a member of Magogoni Vision Group, which is registered with VEP. Lucy has a business and also does farming. She wants to access a loan to construct a biodigester so that she can access clean gas to power her home and kitchen and use the organic bioslurry to grow other crops to sell at nearby markets. She will also distribute biogas to three of her neighbors, who will pay Lucy for their monthly consumption. Altogether, the biodigester will enable her to save on the cost of electricity and be in a position to repay her loan easily.

loans.use: to construct a biodigester

loans.name: Resa

texts.en:
Resa is 40 years old and married with one child.  She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines.  Resa is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Resa has been raising hogs for 4 years and also earns additional income from a general store and livestock sales.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and to acquire a motorcycle for her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita, a 58-year-old mother, aimed to improve her small variety store in order to increase her income.  She has been operating the business for almost one year and usually earns a profit of only 4,000 PHP a month.  As a result, she planned to increase her product offerings in order to satisfy her customers’ demand.  Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional loan of 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of items to sell (soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, dried fish, beverages, seasonings, and vegetables).  She believes that her loan will help her to improve the business and she hopes that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy items for her variety store.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo is 38 years old, is married, and has two children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a coconut production business  in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over three years and earns 10,000PHP every month. He has been a member of GDMCP since the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 13,500PHP to purchase chemicals, such as manure. His hope is to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, such as manure

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 30 years old. He lives in Batumi District, West Georgia, with his wife and his mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Gela requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Gela is involved in agricultural activities. He has a plot of agricultural land where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. He sells the harvested products at local markets. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Gela requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Gela will start up a business selling clothing and bed-clothing. He plans to purchase clothing and bed-clothing at wholesale prices and then resell the goods with his wife at a higher price. They will be able to increase the income of the family. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the business. With another part of the profit they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start up a business selling clothing and bed-clothing

loans.name: Sevdije

texts.en:
Sevdije is 56 years old, married, and the mother of one child. To earn a living, together with her husband she is planning to start up an agricultural business, raising cows and selling milk and milk products in her area. Her husband works as a guard with a very low salary. He tried in different ways to find a better paid job in order to earn income for the family expenses but without success. 

Sevdije is in need of a loan to build a stable and buy a cow. The loan will ensure income for her family by selling milk in the market. She hopes in the future to ensure a better life for her family. His goal is to give a better education to her child. She is very grateful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To build a stable and buy a cow

loans.name: Deiby Estyven

texts.es:
Su nombre Es Deiby tiene 20 años viene de una familia muy humilde y campesina y su historia fue escrita al lado de su mama y su mamita (Abuela) ya que un papa nunca lo conoció, pero siempre estuvo su abuelo hay apoyándole, y es el mayor de 6 hermanos... Su  madre se esforzó mucho en darle estudio siempre tuvo unos sueños, cuando chico como todo niño, cuando empieza a soñar a ser grande y tener logros, así era el… Después siguió creciendo y aun así no dejaba sus sueños, en  un tiempo comenzó a buscar trabajo y un día iba a presentar una entrevista cuando salió algo inesperado y lo llevaron al ejercito al comienzo le dio duro porque necesitaba esa parte de mama a su lado, pero aun así siguió, y aun ahora que no está con ella siente que necesita luchar por ella, por brindarle muchas cosas no solo materiales si no en darle esa alegría de madre en que su hijo salió adelante y darle siempre su apoyo aunque se encuentre lejos de ese calor nunca ha sentido desabrigo que a pesar de tantas cosas aun así le da más razones por las que debe luchar y pensar en su futuro …
Hace unos 3 años aproximadamente llego a la ciudad todavía con sus sueños, si no que ya no los veía tanto como un sueño si no como una meta en la cual debía esforzarse por conseguir ser un Gran Cocinero y ahí comenzó ya lo que es su proyecto de vida y nunca se conforma con solo una cosa, si no estudiar muchas más cosas como ser Dj porque desde niño le gusta la música y  así tener su propio Bar Restaurante
Pues así fue comenzó a trabajar para pagar su propio estudio ya que no tenia  ayuda económica por parte de su familia, pero tiene las ganas de ayudarles a ellos, y agradecerle a su mamita y a su mama por cada cariño que le dieron por lo mucho que le enseñaron que para vivir se necesita soñar y para soñar hay que tener todo claro, y eso es lo que el quiere ser muy grande, tal vez no sea mucho para algunos pero si muy grande en su vida y es ser un profesional y que sus proyectos de vida no queden en una ilusión si no que  su esfuerzo se vea cada día más y más… Que el sueño de un niño nunca acabe a pesar de las derrotar porque lo más bonito de vivir es llegar a cumplir las metas más grandes.
texts.en:
His name is Deiby. He is twenty years old and comes from a humble, rural family. His story was written alongside his mom and his grandma; he never knew a dad, but his grandfather was always there supporting him. He is the oldest of six siblings. His mother worked very hard to give him an education. He always had dreams when he was little; like any boy who is beginning to dream of being a grown-up and accomplishing things, that's how he was. As he continued to grow, he still held on to his dreams. After a while, he started looking for a job; one day he was going to do an interview when something unexpected happened and he was taken in to the army. In the beginning it was hard on him because there was still that part of him that needed his mom, but he stuck with it anyway. Even now that he is not with her, he feels like he needs to keep striving for her sake, to provide for her—not only materially, but also to give her the joy of a mother whose son is getting ahead—and to always give her his support. Even though he is far away from that warmth, he has never felt like he was out in the cold; it just gives him more reason to keep fighting and thinking of his future.

It was approximately three years ago that he arrived in the city, his dreams still intact; actually he no longer saw them as dreams, but rather as a goal that he had to work hard to achieve: to be a great chef. And right then, he set out on what is his life plan. Never limiting himself to just one thing, he also studies many other things, like being a DJ. He has liked music since he was little, and that way, he can have his own restaurant and bar.

So he started working to pay for his own education since he didn't have any financial help from his family; he does want to help them, and to thank his grandma and his mom for all the love they gave him, for all that they taught him: in order to live, you need to dream, and in order to dream, you need to have a clear vision. And that's what he wants, to be great (it might not be much to some people, but in his life, it would be great): to be a professional, and for his life's plan not to remain wishful thinking, but rather for his effort to pay off a little more every day. A boy's dreams should never end, in spite of setbacks, because the most beautiful thing in life is to finally reach one's biggest goals.

loans.use: to complete his culinary education program at CampoAlto.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La Sra. Filomena sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de abarrotes,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como dulces y refrescos por mayor ya que incremento sus ventas y desea surtir su tienda, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Señora Filomena continues the same work of selling basic staples in her neighborhood store. She says it went well with her previous loan since she used it to buy groceries.  This time she asks for the loan in order to buy merchandise like wholesale sweets and soft drinks because it increased her sales and she wishes to stock up her store.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity given to her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, soft drinks, and sweets to stock up her store.

loans.name: Huynh

texts.en:
Huynh was born in 1992.  She has a little child and her husband is a carpenter.  His earnings are about 7,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND).  Huynh is also is a carpenter with an income of about 4,000,000 VND.  She has done this job for 3 years.  Her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month. 

Huynh has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012.  In the last cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time.  In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.  She always wants to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Roseta

texts.en: Roseta works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, which she has had for 4 years.  Roseta requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Roseta would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is 37 years old. He lives in Ikalto village,Telavi district, with his 37 year-old wife, Natia, and retired parents. Archil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
The family has a vineyard and a small plot of agricultural land. They grow grapes and different kinds of vegetables. Harvested products are sold locally at the markets. Archil also has a car. He is working on private orders and transports different kinds of cargo to bring additional income to the family.
Archil requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor.  These people do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Archil will purchase two damaged cars. He will dismantle them for parts and will start selling them separately. As car parts are highly requested in his area, Archil will make a good profit from his new business. Increased income will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase two damaged cars and sell the parts

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie works hard to support her family. Rosie is married and has a seaweeds business in the Philippines.  Rosie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more seaweeds to sell.  Rosie has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seaweeds to sell

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Tan was born in 1971. She has a son and three daughters. Her two older daughters are laborers. The younger daughter is learning in secondary school. Her son is learning in primary school. Her husband is a carpenter and a farmer. He earns about 6,000,000 VND per month. Tan is a laborer and a farmer. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this work for three years. Her family’s total earnings are about 18,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND, which she will use to buy food for her chickens. She always wants to raise her children up well.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Winena

texts.en:
Winena is 62 years old, married, and has nine children. She earns a living by fattening pigs, in the Philippines. She has been fattening pigs for nine years, and she earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Winena is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a 40-year-old widow with two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mercedita has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Mercedita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Mercedita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and married with five children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling firewood in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of firewood to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for two years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Josephine aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1972. She has four children. Her two older daughters are laborers. The younger daughter is learning in primary school. Her son is still really little. Her husband is a farmer and earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Lan is a laborer. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for two years. Her family’s total earnings are about 17,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND. She will use the loan to buy a cow. She wants to have a cow as support for her planting of rice. She always wants to raise her children up well.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie is a married woman who has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vangie is 27 years old and has one child who is in school.
Vangie has a firewood, rice grains and dry goods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more sacks of rice grains and dry goods to sell.  Vangie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Vangie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains and dry goods to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a variety store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Angelina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional items to sell in her store, like bread, canned goods, and soap.

She would like to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store, like bread, canned goods, and soap

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve is 40 years old and married. She has one child who goes to school. She works very hard to provide for her family.
