Gracias a Dios nunca falto la comida y siempre tuvo una muy buena comunicación con su familia, aunque ella casi no compartía con su mama era su mejor amiga. 
Su papa les visitaba cuando podía siempre se esmero por ser un gran padre y ayudar a sus hijas y esposa.
Mientras cursaba sexto grado su papa murió de un paro cardio-respiratorio y fue un golpe muy duro para todas ellas, desde ahí las coas se hicieron más difíciles, su mama de ahí en adelante se encargo de todos los gastos de la casa.
Tiempo después ellos pudieron comprar una linda casa, esto les ayudo mucho, ya que los gastos disminuyeron.
Mientras cursaba grado décimo tuvo la oportunidad de hacer un Técnico en el Sena y la aprovecho, el programa desempeñaba destrezas en Manejo de Maquinaria para la confección de ropa exterior, el cual pudo terminar con éxito al lado de su grado de bachiller.
Cuando salió del colegio no había medios para entrar a estudiar, así que se inscribió al Sena para realizar un programa en Confección de ropa interior lo termino y realizo exitosamente sus pasantías. 
Sacando provecho a esto se dedico a trabajar confeccionando vestidos de baño y ropa interior, alguien quiso colaborar en su estudio y le dio la noticia de que estudiaría en CAMPOALTO.
En la actualidad está cursando Administración Hotelera poniendo mayor esfuerzo de su parte ya que su mama es quien le paga su estudio.
Sus metas terminar sus estudios profesionales y poder desempeñarse satisfactoriamente en ese campo, lograr una estabilidad económica y demás.
texts.en:
Being born the youngest of all her sisters, Ingrit lived with her mother, her sisters, and her nephew.  Thanks to God, she never lacked food, and she always had good communication with her family.  Her mother was her best friend, although she was not able to spend a lot of time with her.

Her father visited them when he could, and always took care to be a great father and to help his daughters and his wife.

When Ingrit was in 6th grade, her father died of a heart attack.  This was a blow to all of them.  From this point on, things became more difficult.  Her mother had to take charge of all of the household expenses.

Sometime later, the family was able to buy a nice house.  This helped them a lot, because the expenses decreased.  In 10th grade, Ingrit took the opportunity to get a technical degree from SENA (a public vocational education program).  In this program, she developed skills in working with machines to make coats and jackets.  She successfully completed this program along with her high school degree.

When Ingrit left school, she had  no means to further her education, so she enrolled in a SENA program to learn how to make underwear.  She finished this program and also successfully completed an internship.

Taking advantage of her training, Ingrit started working making bathing suits and underwear.  Someone wanted to work in her studio, and so she gave notice that she would study at CAMPOALTO (a technical college).

Now Ingrit is studying hotel management, putting in maximum effort on her part, because her mother is paying for her tuition.  Her goals include finishing her professional degree, being able to work satisfactorily in her field, and achieving economic stability.

loans.use: to complete her studies in kitchen management in the hotel management program of CAMPOALTO

loans.name: Loucine

texts.en: Loucine is a 28-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and one sibling. She faced bad circumstances and lived in unpleasant financial conditions. This is why she struggled and worked hard to show her perseverance in being able to enhance her way of living. So in 2005, she started to work as a beautician. She works at her house and also visits customers wherever they are located to provide them with her high-quality beauty services. She is very thankful for the results attained so far thanks to the previous loan she took from Kiva. Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase beauty products and cosmetics so that she can improve her business operations and follow up on the new fashions. In the near future she plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora   de 45  años de edad,  tiene  un hijo que depende de ella, vive con su esposo, en su casa propia, en la comunidad de  San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Dora se dedica desde hace 06 años  al negocio de venta de frescos, golosinas y ropa interior nueva, su venta la realiza de forma ambulante, visita a los pobladores de su comunidad para ofrecerles sus productos.
Doña Dora también vende tacos, enchiladas y refrescos los días sábado y domingo, es una señora trabajadora que lucha día con día para sacar adelante a su familia.
Doña Dora está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de plátanos, papas, yucas, cebollas, tomates, patastes, arroz, queso, mantequilla etc. y también quiere comprar  ropa interior para la venta,  con el apoyo del préstamo  espera  que mejore un poco su situación económica  está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Doña Dora su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013
texts.en:
Dora is 45 and has a dependent son. She lives with her husband in their house in San Lorenzo is southern Honduras. For six years, Dora's business has been selling beverages, candies, and new underwear as a street vendor, visiting local residents to sell them her merchandise. Dora also sells tacos, enchiladas, and beverages on Saturdays and Sundays. She is hardworking and strives every day to provide for her family. 

Dora is applying for a loan to buy bananas, potatoes, yucas, onions, tomatoes, patastes, rice, cheese, butter, and underwear to sell. She hopes to improve her financial situation with this loan. She is pleased to continue working with Prism. Her dream is to make improvements to her house.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2013

loans.use: to buy bananas, potatoes, yucas, onions, tomatoes, patastes, rice, cheese, and butter for her business.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 48 years old. He lives in Kutaisi, West Georgia with his son Revaz, 21, and Natia, eighteen; they both are students. Koba requested a start-up loan several times from local financial institutions but without any success. He was rejected due to his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Koba has an iron workshop. He gets small orders for the production of iron goods. His income, however, is too small to cover monthly expenses.

Then Koba applied for a 1200 USD loan from Credo. His loan request has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Their start-up loan program will provide credit to the rural poor, who do not have access to loans for those regarded as high-risk borrowers due to their low incomes.

With his loan Koba will buy more iron for his workshop. As he is very experienced and well known among the locals, with a bigger stock he will be able to get more orders and produce such goods as gates, beds and railings. The increase in business will bring more income to the family, enabling Nugzar to reinvest in his workshop and cover more of the family’s monthly expenses.

loans.use: to buy more iron for his workshop.

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en:
Martha is 46 years old and lives in the area of Airport in Margibi County, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia, With little income from her husband who works as a security guard at Robert International Air Port, this mother of six children between the ages of 11 and 31 is determined to make their lives better through the sale of rice, soap, charcoal, vita, pepper, oil, etc. In business for 12 year now, Martah enjoys the interactions with her customers.

Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more ice, soap, charcoal, vita, pepper, oil, etc. to expand her sales. Her dream is to expand her business into a store in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more ice, soap, charcoal, vita, pepper, oil, etc. to expand her sales.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married. She has four children who are adults. She lives with her husband who is a carpenter.

Catherine is an artisan who has been involved in weaving since she was very young. This gives her a good income. She learned this profession from her mother, who used to teach her so that she would have the same skill. She has been weaving for 15 years.

Catherine says she has very good hands for handicrafts. She says that she sells her products in Mombasa and also has orders from Nairobi. Her neighbors say she is responsible and hardworking, which are important values for making progress.

She is applying for the loan in order to purchase thread, needles, dyes and additional materials that are essential for weaving. She is thankful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it has given her.

loans.use: To purchase thread, needles, dyes and additional materials that are essential for weaving

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es: Yorlenny, tiene la edad  de 39 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra dos  vacas con buenas características para la producción de leche y que estén al menos de primer parto para asegurar que den una cantidad de leche diaria aceptable. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales y a la vez obtener  leche y desarrollar los terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne y las hembras dejarlas para la producción de leche siempre y cuando cuenten con buenas características para la producción de leche. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar más la actividad, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yorlenny is 39 years old, married and lives with her children and husband, who are her greatest priority.  With her loan she plans on buying two cows that are well-suited for milk production and have had at least one calf.  This will make sure that they give a good amount of milk every day.  Her idea is to take advantage of the grassy space that she has and the good condition of the land and also the good climate so as to be able to have these animals and also get milk from them.  She also hopes to raise the male calves for meat and the females for milk (if they have the traits needed for milk cows).

With this purchase, she will be able to develop her business activity and at the same time save some money that will allow her to have more animals and invest more in her property.  This is the first loan that she has received from Fudecosur.  She hasn't gotten loans from other communal banks, but Fudecosur has offered her a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy milk cows.

loans.name: Kamah

texts.en:
Kamah is 29 years old, married to a businessman, and the mother of three school-going children in Margibi county, the location of the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. For the past seven years Kamah has been involved in business, currently selling palm oil, an activity she learned from her mother.

Walking to the village to buy palm oil, Kamah likes how her customers are often waiting upon her return to purchase her products. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, and plans to build her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 26 years old and lives in Magibi County, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation area in Liberia. Fatu is married and has two children aged 5 and 10 years. They live at home, and the two children attend school.

For the past seven years, Fatu has been running a table market, where she sells fresh fish in the community market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She is appreciative of her business, because it keeps her saving every day and makes her popular. Her plan is to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish, to resell at her business table.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a television set

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth, put designs on it (tint it) and resell it

loans.name: Jamungu

texts.en:
Jamungu is from Tiribe, Mombasa. She is married but has not been blessed with children. 

Jamungu has a store in her home with a well-established customer base. She is very hardworking and an excellent client of Yehu Microfinance. Her husband is employed at a hotel, and the two of them help each other so that they can get ahead. 

Jamungu is requesting this loan to buy sugar, noodles, flour, rice and other products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, flour, rice and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Valodia

texts.en:
Valodia is 55 years old. He lives in Chechela village, Adigeni district, with his 47-year-old wife, Nana. Valodia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. They own a plot of land, where they grow potatoes. The family also has four milking cows, a calf, and eight sheep. They milk the cows to make dairy products, and from the sheep they get wool and also cheese. Harvested potatoes, with the dairy products, are sold locally at the market.

Recently, Valodia requested a loan from Credo to restart a family business. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Valodia wants to start trading in household goods and clothes. He and his wife had a business like this, a few years ago. Because they are already experienced in this field, Valodia decided to restart the business. The loan will be used for purchasing a stock of household goods and clothes at the wholesale price, which will be distributed at the local markets.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of household goods and clothes, with which to restart their business trading in those kinds of products

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and very hardworking. She lives with her partner, and they have four children. They have been living in Tiribe for ten years.

Saumu has a posho mill which she uses to grind maize into flour. She says her job is very demanding because she is the only one in the family who works.

Saumu is applying for a 50,000 KES loan from Yehu to invest in various tools such as drills, spanners and fuel. Her dream is to buy a small lathe in order to do other types of work and so progress every day.

loans.use: to invest in various tools such as drills, spanners and fuel.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is 51 years old and lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren, in Ijevan city. He has also two daughters, who are married and live separately from their parents.

Arayik works as an auto mechanic. He has many years of work experience in this sphere and a good repute in Ijevan city.  He implements his orders perfectly, and all customers are very pleased with his work. As he confessed, the secret of his work's good results, is that he does his work with great pleasure, although his salary is not much. Arayik's son works in the border troops of Armenia. His wife is engaged in clothes trading. His daughter-in-law doesn't work, apart from taking care for her children.

Arayik says that it is too hard to meet his family's needs in Ijevan city, even when his wife and son share their family expenses. So Arayik needs a loan, which he will use to buy some auto repairing materials and tools, for his activity.

loans.use: To buy some materials and tools for his work repairing autos

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en: Kebbeh is 41 years old and lives in Magibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married with four children between 3 and 19 who live at home and attend school. For the past five years she has been selling red oil in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends eight hours a day with her business, and most likely she uses a pickup to have her red oil at her shop. She is appreciative of her business because it keeps her saving every day. Her plan is to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Tulipanes Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento TULIPANES  está compuesto por diez integrantes, nueve mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Tarcia en la foto es la que se encuentra con el bebe, la Sra. Tarcia tiene 33 años y cuatro hijos de las edades de, 7, 5 , 10 y 2 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida, ella no tiene un puesto fijo, ya que entrega sus almuerzos a distintos puestos del mercado donde ella vende, la Sra. Tarcia es una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que la Sra. Tarcia les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas como abarrotes y aceite por mayor, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal, el deseo de la Sra. Tarcia es poder tener un puesto fijo ya que esto le haría crecer más en su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank "Tulipanes" is made up of ten members--nine women and one man. The president of the bank is Tarcia, who is shown in the photo with the baby. Tarcia is 33 years old and has four children aged 10, 7, 5 and 2. She makes a living selling food. She does not have a fixed location but rather delivers lunches to various market stalls where she sells. Tarcia is a very hard working woman that has been able to little by little, obtain stability, solvency and popularity with dedication. She is very well known by her customers who she attends to with friendliness. 

With the money from the loan she will buy supplies to make food, including groceries and wholesale oil. This client says that with a great amount of effort she will be able to grow more and continue making a living for the well being of her family and herself. Tarcia wishes to have a stall that would allow her to grow her business more and in turn, improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy groceries and oil.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 32 years old and lives in Margibi County which has the largest  rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. She is married, and she has four children between 6 and 13 years old. They are currently in school and live at home. For the past six years she has been selling red (palm) oil in the local market. She enjoys the profit-making in the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. Her plans are to build herself a house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more red (palm) oil for her business.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is married and has three children, two of whom still attend school.

She has had a grocery store for three years. She started with the help of her husband, who used his earnings from growing crops to help start the business. The income from this business now covers the household expenses as well as school fees.

Ega is seeking a loan in order to buy noodles, flour, oil, herbs, cookies, candy and drinks, which are the top-selling items in her business. This will enable her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and allow for the possibility of increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, oil, herbs, cookies, candy and drinks.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah is 49 years old, married, and lives in  Margibi County, which has the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia, with her six children who live at home. Only three of them attend school. Her husband is a nurse. From 1984 she has been involved in business and currently she sells cosmetics. She says she likes how her customers walk to get to her when she is selling, especially when she has new goods on hand, and she enjoys how supportive she is to her family. She learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. Her plan is to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en: Nadzua is from Tiribe, Mombasa. Nadzua has been working as a dressmaker for six years. She bought an industrial sewing machine that she uses to make clothes in general. She also gets help from her husband who works in order to cover family expenses. She’s requesting this loan to buy fabric, zippers and thread to make various items to sell.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 29 years old and lives in  Margibi county, which has the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia, with her husband and children. All her children are in school and between 4 and 10 years old.

For 8 years now, Nancy has been involved with selling rice, oil, peppers, etc.in the market. She was taught by her mother how to sell such goods. She spends 8 hours on her business every day. She enjoys the profit she makes every day and how popular she is.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil,  peppers, etc. for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, peppers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 37 years old, married, and she has two children, 6 and 10 years old. The two of them are currently in school and live at home. For the past six years, Shirly has been selling rice, oil, and pepper in the market. She enjoys the profit-making in the business. She uses her profits on feeding and paying school fees for her children, and she is happy to cover her children's expenses. She spends nine hours a day with her business, because her business is the major way of getting money for her home.

Shirly is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more rice, oil, and pepper, to resell at her business. Her plans are to build her house and send her children to college, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and pepper, to resell at her business in the market

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
From Tiribe, Luvuno is married and has nine children, all of whom attend school. She buys and sells goats for meat to butchers. She's a very hardworking and responsible person with more than five years of experience in this area.

Luvuno is applying for a 30,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy more goats. Thanks to her job, her family is getting ahead and they have everything they need. She's grateful for this opportunity because it will help her business grow and improve.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 40 years old and lives in Magibi County, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation area in Liberia. She has seven children, who are from 14 to 25 years old. They are attending school and living at home. Her husband is a businessman. Theresa is respected in her family, and also a mother of a supportive home. 

For the past seven years, Theresa has been selling used clothes in the market. One of the problems she is facing is that she doesn't have a good location for her selling place. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more used clothes, to resell at her business. Her plans are to expand her business and to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in Margibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation region in Liberia. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 4 and 19 years old. They are in school and live at home.

For the past ten years, Nancy has been involved in a cook shop business (restaurant). She makes more profit and has lots of customers. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, and charcoal for use in her restaurant. Her plan is to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, and charcoal for her restaurant

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 39 years old and lives in Magibi County, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and has three children between 8 and 19 years old. All three of them are currently in school and live at home. Her husband is a Firestone worker.

For the past 15 years, Helena has been selling lappa (traditional cloth), body cream, powder, etc. in the local market. She enjoys the profits she receives from her business. She spends eight hours on her business, and most of the time she uses a taxi to get her goods to her selling place.

Helena is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa, body cream, powder, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional cloth), body cream, powder, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Jane, a 35-year-old married mother of one, lives in Kyotera with her husband and two step children. A fish monger since 1996, Jane managed to acquire several plots of land in Kyotera and now has some rental housing in Kinankole zone that provides a secondary source of income for her family.

Jane began selling fish because Kyotera is located near the shore of Lake Kijjanabalora, which has high quality tilapia fish. She acquired from her grandfather knowledge of storage, drying, and maintaining fish which she applies in her business. She sells her products to individuals from Kyotera and traders who take them to Kampala.

Jane, who describes herself as an honourable, hardworking, honest, and God-fearing person, is requesting this loan to purchase roofing materials for her residential house.

One of her dreams is to build several rental houses in Kyotera, and she hopes to be one of the people with the largest estates in town in the near future. She has not yet achieved her goals due to fish price fluctuations which sometimes lead to losses since she cannot preserve all of her products for a long period of time.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials for her house.

loans.name: La Florida Group

texts.es: El grupo “LA FLORIDA” grupo conformado por 5 mujeres emprendedoras dedicadas a diferentes aéreas del trabajo. Se encuentran pasando el sexto ciclo. Auria es secretaria del grupo tiene 62 años hace 21 años se dedica al alquiler de cuarto. El préstamo que se le dio lo usara para cambiar las puertas de los cuartos que da en alquiler puertas de madera por las de fierro. Grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA. Aurea es la segunda dela lado izquierdo esta con blusa beis.
texts.en: The "La Florida" group is made up of 5 entrepreneurial women in different lines of work. They are in their sixth loan cycle. Aurea is the group secretary. She is 62 years old and for 21 years she has rented rooms. She will use the loan that she was given to change the doors on the rooms she rents from wood to iron. The group thanks the Kiva lenders. Aurea is the second one from the left with the beige blouse.

loans.use: to buy iron doors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu is married, 39 years old, and lives in Magibi county, which is the greatest-producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She lives with her husband and children. All her children are in school and are between the ages of 4 and 10. 

Ten years now, she has been selling rubber dishes in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this way of selling from her mother. The problem she faces is the rainy season. 

Bindu is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes (i.e., plates, cups, bowls) for her business. Her plans are to build a house and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (i.e., plates, cups, bowls) for her business.

loans.name: Buenas Amistad Group

texts.es:
MARITZA; tiene 24 años, es una madre joven de dos pequeños niños quienes son su razón de ser y de superación. Ella forma parte del grupo "Buenas Amistad" formado por cinco socios. Este grupo va por su tercer desembolso han demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad.
Maritza desde hace un años aproximadamente inició un negocio de comida, debido a la necesidad de afrontar los gatos de sus pequeños hijos ya que ella los debe criar sola, vio la oportunidad de poner un negocio de comida, el cual desarrolla de forma ambulatoria ya que no cuenta con los recursos como para alquilar un local y mucho menos para comprarlo. Poco a poco ha ido consiguiendo su clientela y la buena sazón la ha ayudado.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos de mayor uso en sus alimentos, asi como también en platos y vasos que es lo que mas se necesita en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza is 24 years old. She is a young mother to two small children, who are her reason for living and for moving ahead. She is part of the "Buenas Amistad" ("Good Friendship") group, which is made up of five members. This group is on its third loan cycle and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility.

Approximately one year ago, Maritza started a food business due to the need to confront her small children's expenses, since she has to raise them alone. She saw the opportunity to start a food business, which she has developed as a street vendor since she does not have the resources to rent a location, much less buy one. Little by little she has gotten customers and her good seasoning has helped her.

She will use the loan received to buy supplies she uses often in her food as well as plates and glasses, which are what she most needs in her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is 48 years old and lives with 3 with her 5 children.  The children at home are between the ages of 16 and 28; they are in school.

She has been running a cook shop (restaurant) for 22 years; she sells delicious Liberian food.  One of the problems she faces are complaints from the costumers about the high price of food, since the price of ingredients is high.  She says she makes lot of profit since she is the one who  prepares the delicious Liberian dishes.

Yassah started this business with help from her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, Vita, onions, peppers, oil, charcoal, meat, fish, and beans, etc. for her business. 

Her plans are to educate her children, and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, Vita, onions, peppers, oil, charcoal, meat, fish, and beans, etc for her business

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en:
Janjay is 46 years old and lives in Margibi County, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She has six children between the ages of 11 and 23 who are in school and live at home.

For the past ten years, Janjay has been running a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells delicious Liberian food, and also cold water and soft drinks. She spends 12 hours with her business, and she said, “I am a business-minded person, and hardworking.”

A problem Janjay is facing is the complaining of the customers (high price of food). She says she makes a lot of profit, since she is one who prepares a delicious Liberian dish. She started this business with help from her mother, and learned this way of selling from her.

Janjay is requesting a loan to buy more rice, onions, pepper, oil, charcoal, cold water and soft drinks for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, onions, pepper, oil, charcoal, cold water and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 25-year-old, single man. Ammar is a blacksmith and owns his own workshop, but the income he generates is not enough to cover all of his living costs.

Ammar is preparing himself to get married soon, so he wants to finish building his own house, to which he can bring home his bride. Ammar is requesting a 3,000 USD Youth Loan from FATEN. He will use the loan to cover the cost of purchasing construction supplies, such as bricks and cement. This will enable Ammar to prepare a suitable house to live in, soon, with his coming wife.

Ammar was photographed in the location of his house.

loans.use: To buy bricks and cement to use to finish building the house, to which he will bring home his bride

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is a 41-year-old man. He is a father, with two sons and one daughter. 

For the past eight years, Ramadan has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable business and the only source of income to the family.

Ramadan is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and will enable Ramadan to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income.

Ramadan is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mariam has run a business from her home for four years. At the beginning, she worked as a farmer. After saving a little money from her efforts, as well as her husband's, she started a business of buying and selling goats for meat. Her husband supports her in the business. 

She hopes to continue growing as a business to be able to offer a better future for her children. Mariam would like the loan to buy livestock, as the sales of the animals generates a good profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Petrona Maritza

texts.es: Doña Petrona, es una clienta casada su esposo en la actualidad está sin empleo, por  lo que ahora a ella le toca que trabajar más en su labor como domestica para una empresa privada,  para poder mantener a sus hijos y que tengan una buena educación. Petrona está solicitando su onceavo crédito para empezar a levantar el muro perimetral del lado sur de su casa, para garantizar la seguridad y marcar su espacio de terreno, para esta construcción requiere comprar cemento, arena, hierro, bloques por el cual necesita el apoyo de financiamiento.
texts.en: Petrona is a married client. Her husband is currently out of work, so now it is up to her to work more at her job as a domestic employee for a private company in order to be able to support her children and for them to have a good education. Petrona is asking for her eleventh loan to start building a perimeter wall on the south side of her house to guarantee security and mark the boundary of her land. She will need to buy cement, sand, iron, and blocks for this construction, and for this she needs the support of the loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and blocks

loans.name: Santos Leopoldo

texts.es:
Don Santos tiene 61 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos y vive en el Municipio de Esparta, San Juan Pueblo.
Don  Santos tiene muchos años de experiencia en la agricultura. Hace 20 años esta cultivando     palma africana de donde se extrae el aceite, también tiene una plantación de frutas cítricas (rambután), piña, maíz, caña, cocos y yuca. La producción que saca la distribuye a intermediarios y la paga es rentable. Todo el esfuerzo y dedicación es para obtener los ingresos que cubran los gastos del hogar.
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante para el l cultivo de la palma africana y de la fruta (rambután). Y darle una mejor asistencia técnica, logrando así el control de plagas. 
Sus metas es seguir trabajando y obtener mejores ganancias para darle bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: Santos, 61, is married, has 2 children and lives in the municipality of Esparta, San Juan Pueblo. Santos has many years of experience working in agriculture. For 20 years he's been cultivating African palm from which he extracts oil, he also has a citrus fruit plantation of rambutan (closely related to the lychee), he also cultivates pineapple, corn, cane, coconuts and yucca. What he produces is distributed to intermediaries and the pay is feasible. All of his efforts and dedication are so he can generate the income he needs to cover the household expenses. He's requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer for his African palm and rambutan tree, so he can provide technical assistance to his crop by controlling the plagues. His goals are to continue working and generating a higher income to ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to assist the growth of his Africa palm and rambutan plantations in order to sell the produce.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 45-year-old, married man, and a father to two sons and three daughters. He is employed, but the small salary he earns is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Bilal appears in the photo.

Bilal lives with his family in a small village near Jenin. They live in an old house, in modest conditions. Bilal is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN, which he will use to cover the cost of buying paints and hiring workers, to paint the house. Taking this loan will enable Bilal and his family to create suitable home conditions for themselves, and enable them to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To paint the house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to replenish her capital by buying fish (ndagala), flour, and bananas to sell so that she can continue to earn her living.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Amal is a 35-year-old married woman from Qalqilia. She lives in a small house in the city with her husband and a small son. 

Amal works as a teacher, and her husband is a worker. Both salaries barely cover the family’s needs. She is looking to improve her home, especially the bedroom, the bathroom and the kitchen. She does not have enough money for this, so she needs a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. 

This loan will help Amal and her family to improve their home.

loans.use: to pay the costs of improving the family home.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 46 years old and lives in the Airport community; she is married with 6 children between the ages of 16 and 28.  Four of her children live at home and attend school.

For the last 3 years she has had a table in the market, where she sells fish to her community. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother.  Annie appreciates her business because it gives her a way of saving every day, and she is popular. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business.

Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old, single young man. For the past one and one-half year, Mohammad has had a grocery store, selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover its costs.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN. He will use the loan to help him cover the costs of purchasing a needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, sugar, milk, and canned food. This will increase his sales and increase Mohammad's income.

Mohammad was photographed inside his store.

loans.use: To buy a needed stock of basic groceries for his store

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en:
Tahreer is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Tahreer is a 26-year-old, married woman, from Qalqilia. She is a mother of two sons. 

She lives with her husband and children in an old house. Her husband is a worker with a low wage. They are working now to build a new house with better conditions. She is looking forward to completing the new home. She does not have enough money for this, so she needs a loan of USD 1,500 from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). Her home will be completed and will be ready to live in with her family.

loans.use: to pay the cost of building the family home.

loans.name: Domyan

texts.en:
Domyan is a 28-year-old single young man. He is employed, and gets a low salary which is not enough to cover all of his costs.

Domyan wants to complete the building of his own house, to ensure better living conditions for him, and in the future, when he marries. Domyan is requesting a 2,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing more construction supplies such as cement, sand, and bricks. This will provide Domyan better living conditions with his own house.

Domyan is photographed in front of his new house.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to complete the building of his house.

loans.name: Puyas Raimundi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PUYAS RAIMUNDI”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Claudia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: Venta de frutas, venta de comida, Atención de tienda de barrio, costura de polleras, venta de refrescos, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Claudia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; mismo que decide abrir por recomendación de su madre hace  varios años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de una comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The "Puyas Raimundi" communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Regional Office. It is composed of six members and is directed by a board, of which Claudia is president. The members of the communal bank have a variety of businesses. Among them are: selling fruit, selling food, customer service at a neighborhood store, making polleras (traditional Andean skirts), selling soft drinks, and knitting blankets.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microbusinesswomen like Claudia. She says that this is the first time she has been part of Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling food, the same one she decided to open on the recommendation of her mother several years back.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (purchasing rice, beans, and oil) that she will obtain from the fairs in the city of La Paz to subsequently prepare and sell at the fairs in a community. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her household as much as possible, since she is single and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and oil

loans.name: Lucidy

texts.en:
Lucidy is 42 years old and married with six children, four of whom is in school. Lucidy works very hard to provide for them.
Lucidy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, spices, sugar, milk, noodles, etc..
Lucidy has been in this business for 7 years.
In the future Lucidy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, spices, sugar, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jumah

texts.en:
Jumah is a 33-year-old single man. He is employed and earns a small salary that is insufficient to cover his needs. So he works an extra job doing services like typing and research. 

Jumah would like to buy a new laptop to help him work more efficiently, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Jumah to do his extra job and  earns more money. 

Jumah is photographed with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his job.

loans.name: Myrvete

texts.en:
Myrvete is a married mother of two daughters. They live in the southern part of Kosovo. She is a housewife, and her husband is a driver in one of the private companies, with a very low salary. They are very poor. Currently they live in an old house, and they don’t have enough money. They are unable to afford to do the needed renovation for their toilet.
 
For this reason, Myrvete is requesting a loan, which she will use to renovate her toilet. The loan will help Myrvete and her husband to improve the living conditions for their family. Her goal is to find a regular, stable job, and thereby to secure money for her children. She appreciates all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate the toilet in her home

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 28-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He is the father for one son and one daughter. Muhammad works as an employee, with a low wage. He would like to offer better life conditions for his family, by buying some home appliances for his home, especially a refrigerator.

Muhammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him cover the cost of buying a new refrigerator for his home. Muhammad appears in the Kiva profile photo.


FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his home

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme works hard to support her family. Noeme is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Noeme requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, eggs, spices, and soft drinks.

Noeme has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, Noeme would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, eggs, spices, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 28-year-old single man form Khan Younis. He works as an employee with a low wage. He would like to complete his new home and be ready to get married. So he would like to buy some appliances like a refrigerator, washing machine and air conditioner. Shadi is requesting a $2150 Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing these new home appliances. Taking this loan will help Shadi to acquire all the necessary items for him and his future wife.
Shadi appears in the photo in a home appliance store.
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Nehad

texts.en:
Nehad is a 33-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He works as an employee, with a medium wage. He would like to offer better life conditions for his family, so he works also as a taxi driver. This job is somewhat profitable. But his taxi needs some repairing and new paint.

Nehad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him cover the cost of fixing and painting his taxi. Nehad appears in the photo, beside his taxi.

loans.use: to pay the cost of fixing his taxi

loans.name: Guido

texts.es: El Sr. Guido  tiene 22 años, el se dedica  a la venta de  ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Batallas, la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Guido  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de llantas y mantenimiento de su movilidad ya que este vehículo le ayuda a transportar su ganado a los distintas ferias para su venta,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos, el Sr. Guido  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar la alimentación de su ganado.
texts.en: Guido, 22, is dedicated to the sale of bovine cattle. He lives in Batallas area, the inhabitants of that area work in farming and breeding. This is his first loan with the institution. Guido will use the loan to buy tires and for the maintenance of his vehicle as it is this vehicle that helps him transport his cattle to sell at different fairs. His reason for requesting this loan is that he lacks the money to buy anything himself and this will benefit him greatly, and this way he can improve his income. Guido faces challenges in his business like cattle fodder that he must buy every so often and he'll use the benefits to improve the nutrition of his cattle.

loans.use: maintain his vehicle and buy tires.

loans.name: Lilia Sarahi

texts.es:
La señora Lilia de 26  años de edad, es madre soltera,  tiene  un hijo que depende de ella, vive con sus padres en la comunidad de  San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio  de pulpería.
Doña Lilia sus clientes le prefieren por su buen surtido en su pulpería, es una mujer sola que está luchando por salir adelante con su familia.
Doña Lilia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de café, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aguas, leches, quesos, jugos, huevos, manteca, pan, etc. porque  viene la semana santa y desea surtir su negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes.
Doña Lilia con el apoyo de este préstamo espera que incrementen sus ventas y sus ingresos y que mejore un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Lilia está contenta de trabajar con Prisma y su sueño es tener su propia casa y un negocio más grande.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013
texts.en:
Lilia, 26, is a single mother. She has a child that depends on her and she lives with her parents in the San Lorenzo community, in the south of Honduras. For the past 2 years she has run a grocery store business. 
Lilia's clients prefer her because she 
has a good assortment of products in the store. 
She is a woman alone fighting to get ahead with her family. She is requesting the loan to buy coffee, sugar, rice, beans, water, milk, cheese, juice, eggs, butter, bread, etc., as Eater week is coming and she'd like to better attend her clients. 
With the support of this loan, Lilia hopes to increase sales and thus increase her income in order to improve her family's quality of life. 
Lilia is happy to work with Prism and her dream is to have her own house and a bigger business. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2013

loans.use: buy coffee, sugar, rice, beans, water, milk, cheese, juice, eggs, butter, bread for her store.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 53 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by fattening pigs, in the Philippines. She has been fattening pigs for seven years, and she earns additional income from fish vending.

Charito is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional feed for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Romilyn

texts.en:
Romilyn is 24 years old, married, and has one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for four years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Romilyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Faby

texts.en: Faby lives in Darbouze, Haiti in an area with erratic access to electricity. He already has a small boutique that sells motorcycle parts, but he has started to sell clean energy products with EarthSpark as a clean energy entrepreneur. He sold out of his products so quickly that he has paid off his first loan and is now coming back for another loan to double his business with an EarthSpark “Business in a Bag.” This is a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials, and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills. He would like to sell solar desk lamps as well as the Recho Gaz Blan and the Recho Mirak. The Recho Gaz Blan is a kerosene cookstove, and the Recho Mirak is a charcoal-efficient cookstove, both of which help the environment by reducing the need for charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Jhired-Dios Proveedor Group

texts.es:
JORGE; tiene 64 años de edad, es un cliente antiguo de la Institución que se retiró por motivos personales, y que en ésta ocasión regresa para pertenecer al grupo "Jhired-Dios Proveedor", el grupo está formado por seis socios y el Sr. Jorge fue elegido por sus compañeros como secretario de la Junta Directiva del grupo.
Jorge, se dedica desde hace mas de quince años a prestar servicio como mecánico, trabaja en una zona muy comercial donde tiene su taller, poco a poco se ha ganado un prestigio por lo que sus cientes llegan de diferentes distritos tanto cercanos como lejanos para solicitarle sus servicios.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para tener en stock y así poder brindar un mejor servicio, rápido y completo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jorge, 64, is a long-standing client of the institution who retired for personal reasons.  Currently he's returning to belong to the Jhired-Dios Proveedor group, made up of six members.  Jorge was chosen by his colleagues to be the secretary of the board of directors of the group.

Jorge has made a living as a mechanic for more than 15 years.  He works in a very commercial area where he has his shop.  Little by little he has earned prestige, and his customers come from different districts, both nearby as well as far away, to request his services.

He'll invest the loan he receives in buying parts to have in stock so he can give his customers better, faster, and complete service.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old, married, and has eight children, two of whom are currently going to school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for five years, and she earns additional income from keeping a general store.

Teresita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jean Adrien

texts.en:
Jean Adrien lives in Formond, Chantal, in the South Department of Haiti in an area with erratic access to electricity. For one year he has had a grocery store that sells food supplies. He is an environmental agent in his locality, and one of the reasons he wants to sell cookstoves and solar energy desk lamps is because he doesn’t like seeing people cut down trees to produce charcoal. EarthSpark's efficient cookstoves can help minimize the effects of charcoal on the environment by reducing carbon emissions and deforestation.
He has recently decided to start selling EarthSpark clean energy products to expand his current business. 
With a Kiva loan, Jean will be set up with a “Business in a Bag,” a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support her family. Emelia is single and has a house rental business in the Philippines.

Emelia requested a PHP 19,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials, like wood, paints, nails, and bamboo for her business.

Emelia has been in this business for four years now. In the future, Emelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, like wood, paints, nails, and bamboo for her business.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Erma is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Erma has a general store business in the Philippines. Erma requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items, like soft drinks, spices, soap, shampoo, and canned goods.

Erma has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Erma would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, like soft drinks, spices, soap, shampoo, and canned goods.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 76 years old, married, and has seven children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for 10 years, and she earns additional income from farming sugarcane, and has been keeping a general store for 21 years.
 
Flora is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase feed and additional vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and additional vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 61 years old, married, and has two children. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for five years, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Antonia requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase materials for the repair of her pig pens, and to buy feed.

She would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her pig pens, and to buy feed

loans.name: Marylyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children who are in school, Marylyn works hard to support her family. She has a business trading in rice in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from keeping a general store.  

Marylyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Marylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Alma Iris

texts.es:
La Señora Alma Iris trabaja desde hace tres años para una empresa pública como responsable de control de pago de planilla del personal

solicita un crédito para realizar pago de diploma de universidad y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que Ceprodel les brinda con estos préstamos.
texts.en:
Alma Iris has worked for three years for a public company as the person responsible for payroll control.

She's requesting a loan to pay the fees for her university degree.

She's grateful for the support CEPRODEL provides with these loans.

loans.use: to pay the fees for her university degree

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es: Ruben de 31 años de edad  tienen un negocio en su propio domicilio, donde ofrece el servicio de juegos; su clientela cada vez crece mas, los televisores están siendo utilizados en el 100% de su capacidad y muchos de sus jóvenes clientes, se van del negocio de Rubén,  sin haber accedido a su oferta. Esta es la razón principal por la cual necesita agregar 2 televisores y dos video consolas, para ampliar la oferta de juegos y modernizarla, para ello ha acudido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual responderá a las necesidades de su demanda. Rubén cuenta con 2 años de experiencia en su negocio y cuando inició su actividad, lo hizo  entendiendo que era una necesidad en la comunidad, pues  niños  y jóvenes  no contaban con esta distracción en la que él también encontró su propio generador de ingresos. Hoy se encuentra muy contento, porque ha logrado sostenerse, crecer y tiene muchas expectativas de ampliación y fortalecimiento empresarial; él inicia su día laboral, desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde y su meta mas adelante es lograr hacer ampliaciones locativas, parta generar un mayor confort entre sus consumidores, mientras él aumenta así mismo sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ruben is 31 years old. He has a gaming business in his own home. His customer base keeps increasing and his TV screens are at a 100% use, so many young clients leave Ruben's premises without being able to play. In order to increase and modernize the variety of games offered, Ruben needs to add two additional screens and two game consoles. He is asking for his first loan from Kiva through the field partner, Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, in order to meet the demands of his customers. 
Ruben has had his business for 2 years. He thinks the business fills a need in the community, where children and young adults didn't have this type of entertainment before, and it also provides his income. He is very happy because he can provide for himself, the business has grown and he has a lot of expectations for increasing and strengthening his business. He works from 8 am to 6 pm. His goal in the future is to extend his premises to make it more comfortable for his customers while increasing his profit.

loans.use: to add 2 screens and 2 game consoles.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca  tiene  31  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y dos hijos actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende  arreglar el vehículo de trabajo, ya que ella junto con el esposo se dedica a la ebanistería y necesitan el carro para transportarse y además para transportar algunos muebles pequeños. Ella piensa arreglar el carro y seguir con su esposo adelante con el proyecto de ebanistería y poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Rebeca is 31 years old. She is married and now lives with her husband and two children. With the loan she intends to repair their work vehicle, since she and her husband work in cabinetmaking, and they need the car to transport themselves and furthermore to transport some small furniture.

She is planning to repair the car and continue on with the cabinetry project with her husband, in order to generate more earnings to contribute to her family. This is why she is applying for a loan, and it will be the first loan that she receives from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair her work vehicle

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Cecilia, tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive junto a uno de ellos, reside en una colonia del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, lleva aproximadamente 25 años de generar su propio ingreso. Doña Cecilia actualmente vende productos de belleza y cosméticos de productos Avon y Selcia como cremas, lociones, champú, desodorantes, maquillajes etc. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y a través de pedidos por catálogos. Además tiene apartamentos de alquiler donde obtiene otros ingresos. Ha sido cliente de ODEF por varios ciclos, actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo por 23,000 Lempiras que es el 14 ciclo de préstamo, con el cual va comprar cremas, lociones, champú, maquillajes y otros para seguir vendiendo. Su plan es lograr poner una mini tienda en su casa.
texts.en: Doña Cecilia is 58 years old. She is a single mother and has three children. She lives with one of them in a neighborhood in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. She has always worked in business. She has generated her own income for approximately 25 years. Doña Cecilia now sells Avon and Selcia beauty products and cosmetics, such as creams, lotions, shampoo, deodorants, makeup, etc. She makes her sales as a street vendor and through catalog orders. In addition, she has apartments that she rents, where she obtains additional income. She has been a client of ODEF for a number of years. Now she is applying for a loan of 23,000 Lempiras, which will be her 14th loan, and with which she is going to buy creams, lotions, shampoo, makeup, and other items to continue selling. Her plan is to set up a mini-store in her house.

loans.use: to buy Avon and Selcia beauty products to sell, such as creams, shampoo, lotions, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Positivas Group

texts.es: El grupo “MUJERES PSITIVAS”  se encuentra pasando el ciclo 21 conformado por 7 mujeres dedicadas a diversas actividades del comercio. Gliceria  es una de las integrantes del grupo tiene 51 años. Tiene una bodega donde vende al por menor alimentos, bebidas, tabaco. Actividad que realiza hace 8 años. El préstamo que se le dio lo utilizara en la compra de más productos para su negocio, arroz, azúcar. Aceite, bebida, tabaco. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Gliceria es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste con blusa beis.
texts.en: The group "Mujeres Positivas" (Positive Women) is in its 21st loan cycle. It consists of seven women who work in various business activities. Gliceria is one of the members of the group. She is 51 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells food, beverages, and tobacco. She has been doing this for eight years. She will use her loan to purchase more products for her business, such as rice, sugar, oil, beverages, and tobacco. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan. Gliceria is the second one on the left side wearing the beige blouse.

loans.use: to buy rice, beverages, sugar, oil, and snuff for her store.

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en:
Lourdesita is a widow who operates a rice sales business. She has been in this business for two years and works hard to support her family. 

She is requesting a PhP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She intends to use her loan funds to buy additional sacks of rice to offer for sale.

In the future, Lourdesita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Leonelyn

texts.en:
Leonelyn is 29 years old and married with two children.

Leonelyn earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig-fattening for two years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Leonelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Reylyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Reylyn works hard to support her family.

She has a photo shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Reylyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials, such as toner, photo paper, ink, etc. for her photo shop business.

Reylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed for her business, such as toner, photo paper, ink, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Emma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, toothpaste, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Emma has been in this business for 29 years. She earns more income from pig-fattening.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, toothpaste, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines.

Nelida requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Nelida has been in this business for 30 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito is a farmer living in Alcala with his wife and children. He plants and harvests rice to sell to traders. He usually gains about PHP 10,000 each harvest season twice a year which goes for meals, bills at home, school fees and revolving capital in the business. He would like to keep acquiring abundant harvests on the farm but has insufficient funds. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

Someday, Lito hopes to keep improving his farming practices and continue earning good profits for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 41 years old, married and has three children; two of them are in school. 

Rowena is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos, de 59 años de edad , esta casado con Rosa y juntos viven con su hija de 15 años, ya que sus otros hijos son independientes. Su vivienda es propia y esta ubicada en un anexo agrícola.Marcos se dedica a las actividades agrícolas. “Tengo como 30 años en la agricultura, he pasado muchas cosas buenas y malas, pero todo te enseña”, menciona. Él cultiva arvejas, papas y flores de gladiolos mayormente, porque también siembra maíz y cebada, pero en pocas cantidades. Tiebe como meta más cercana abrir una tienda de artículos para instalar sistemas de irrigación al lado de su hijo. Por ahora se enfoca en sembrar más arvejas y maíz.
Marcos, invertirá los S/.3800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos .Ademas se muestra agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Marcos, 59 years of age, is married to Rosa and together they live with their daughter, aged 15, while their other children are now independent. They own their own house, located in an agricultural community. Marcos dedicates himself to agricultural activities. “I have some 30 years in agriculture,” he mentions, and “I have experienced many things, good and bad, but everything teaches you something.” 

He cultivates green peas, potatoes, and gladiola flowers principally, and he also grows corn and cabbage, but in smaller quantities. His immediate goal is to open a store with his son to sell components for irrigation systems. For the present, he is focused on planting more peas and corn.

Marcos will invest the 3,800 sols in purchasing organic fertilizer to fortify his crops. He is very grateful for the financial help he receives and promises to make his payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene la edad de 28 años, está casada y vive con el esposo. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de cerras y madera para hacer casas para las abejas, para su reproducción de miel. Ella desea aumentar las casas de abejas, y con ello aumentar la producción de miel y a si mismo los ingresos. Doña Silvia trabaja desde hace muchos años con su esposo en esta área de apicultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Silvia is 28 years old, married, and lives with her husband. The loan that she requires is to buy wood and other materials to make bee hives for her honey business. She wishes to increase the number of hives and honey production so that her income also increases. Sra. Silvia and her husband have worked for many years in apiculture.

Her hope for the future is to provide her family with a better standard of living and greater economic stability.

This is Silvia’s first loan with FUDECOSUR. She has not had any previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR provided her with a simple payment schedule and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: buy wood and other materials to make bee hives

loans.name: Belarmina

texts.es:
Belarmina, tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive con ellos en una colonia del municipio de Choloma, Cortes.	
Hace dos años que decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercadería como ser ropa, productos plásticos, juguetes, lociones, cremas, sandalias y achinería. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante  y en su casa. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 11,000 Lempiras para surtir de mercadería como flotadores, cremas y piscinas para vender en esta temporada de verano. Su plan es seguir creciendo con el negocio y alquilar un local fijo solo para el negocio.
texts.en:
Belarmina is 31 years old, married with two children and lives in a neighbourhood in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.

Two years ago she decided to sell merchandise such as clothing, plastic products, toys, lotions, creams, sandals, and other low-cost consumer goods. She sells the items in the streets and from her home.

Belarmina is now seeking a loan of 11,000 lempiras to buy stock such as waterwings, creams, and paddling pools to sell during the current summer season. Her plan is to continue expanding her business and rent fixed premises from which to run it.

loans.use: buy water wings, paddling pools, and creams to sell during the summer season

loans.name: Merlito

texts.en:
Merlito grows rice to sell. He is 53 years old and a widower, and has been responsible for fulfilling the needs of his family. He plants and harvests rice to sell and also pays for laborers who helped him in the rice field. 

He hopes to improve crop production, so he is seeking additional capital of PHP 30,000. He will buy farm inputs (fertilizer and pesticides) to sustain his crops and hopes to have an abundant harvest. 

Merlito hopes to keep improving crop production and upgrade his family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizer and pesticides) to use in farming

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a widow, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Aida is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of clothing for her business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear  clothing to sell

loans.name: Ma. Villaluz

texts.en:
Ma. Villaluz works hard to support nine children. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Ma. Villaluz requested a PHP 7500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Ma. Villaluz is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Orlando
