texts.es: Orlando, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 44 años de edad, esta soltero y vive con los padres actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar semilla y los insumos necesarios para la realización de un almacigo de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad y así poder sembrarlo en una pequeña propiedad que tiene junto sus padres , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
44-year old Orlando is an entrepreneur. He is single and currently lives with his parents. He is seeking a loan to buy seeds and the necessary supplies to make a small coffee plant nursery. His goal is to make sure the plants stay healthy as they develop so that when they are ready for planting, they are of good quality. He will plant them in a small piece of land that he owns next to his parents. 

The only limitation that Orlando faces in order to get ahead is a lack of money. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a simple payment schedule and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: buy seeds to make a coffee plant nursery

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 23 años de edad, esta soltero y vive con los padres y dos hermanos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar   los insumos y bolsas y semilla para realizar un almacigo de café, con la finalidad de sembrar una parte y vender la otra a los vecinos y a personas de otras comunidades cercanas  , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para dicha actividad, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Roger, an enterprising man, is 23 years old and single. He currently lives with his parents and two siblings. He is asking for a loan with the dream of purchasing the supplies and bags and seed in order to start a coffee tree seedling business, with the goal of harvesting part of the seedlings and selling the others to neighbors and to people in other communities nearby.  The only limitation that this gentleman has is the lack of funds to begin the business.  For that reason he is requesting a loan.  This is the first loan that he has received from Kiva partner FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with greater ease and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and bags and seed in order to start a coffee tree seedling business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 39 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis, Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns about 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and she has now requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. Her hope and dream is to have a better future and improve her living situations.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou, 52 years old, is married; she and her husband are blessed with four children. They currently reside in the village of Alicaocao. For almost 12 years, Marilou has owned and operated a retail store in which she sells rice grains and gas tanks. In this business, she earns a net income of 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more rice grains and gas tanks to sell. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted so that she can expand and further improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice grains and gas tanks to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 46 years old. She is married and has three children. Imelda and her spouse manage a hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice. Aside from rice farming, Imelda also raises hogs to sell as an additional source of income. Monthly, she earns about 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). 

Imelda hopes to improve her crop production; for this reason, she has asked for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs for the farming. If the rice crop has enough sustenance, the harvest will be plentiful. From this, Imelda will attain a continuous profit she can use for her children's education, which is her only legacy to them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay farming labor costs.

loans.name: Yamoussa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1967 à Ouayere commune de Farakala, Monsieur  Yamoussa est marié et père de cinq enfants. Il réside avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants dans sa propre maison à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié aux activités commerciales notamment aux stockage et commercialisation des céréales, il y’a maintenant sept années. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. 
Ainsi, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il sollicite ce deuxième crédit lui permettant d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de ses clients. 
Avec ce deuxième prêt il compte acheter,  25 sacs de mil, 35 sacs de maïs et 25 sacs de riz.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 180 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Yamoussa was born around 1967 in Ouayere, in the commune of Farakala.  He is married and the father of five children.  He lives with his two wives and his children in his own house in Hamdallaye, one of the working class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Not having had the opportunity to go to school, Yamoussa initially got involved in several unsuccessful activities, but he quickly learned to do business, storing and selling grains in particular.  He has now been working in this field for seven years.  His vast experience in this domain has earned him a good reputation and he receives many orders.  However, he does not have the necessary resources to meet his needs.

Yamoussa has therefore decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso, and he is requesting his second loan.  This loan will help him to increase his business in order to better meet his customers' expectations.  He plans to use this loan to buy 25 bags of millet, 35 bags of maize and 25 bags of rice.

Thanks to this loan, Yamoussa is expecting monthly profits to reach 180,000 CFA francs.  He plans to use his profits to take care of most of his personal and family expenses, to pay off his loan interest and to invest in his main business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grains.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo lives in Alcala with his spouse and children. He is a farmer planting and harvesting rice to sell. Ricardo has been in the business for over 10 years and usually earns 15,000 PHP during harvest season twice a year. He hopes to improve his crop production because he is educating his children. 

Ricardo is asking for additional capital of 22,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use while farming. It will nourish his crops and someday produce an abundant harvest.

Ricardo will be very happy and proud seeing his children with good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use while farming.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 34 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas to earn a living. She has been in her business for more than six years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase chemicals for banana production. Her hopes and dreams in life are to have a better future and improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a 59-year-old married farmer. His wife also raise hogs for additional income. He has been in the farming business for over 10 years. He untiringly maintains a good harvest from the rice field. 

Mario is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use while farming. This will improve the growth of his crops. 

Mario hopes to gain additional profits for his family and someday improve their living conditions. Mario's photo was taken in his rice field.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use while farming.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 50 years of age. She is widowed and has one child. Despite her situation as a single parent, she is still able to cover all their household expenses. Nenita dreams of having a viable source of income and a better way of life.

Nenita sells rice in the market. She has been running her rice retailing business for more than 14 years. Nenita wants to increase her profits, so she is asking for a loan of 30,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP), which will allow her to buy more rice to be sold. She hopes and prays that her requested loan amount will be granted so she can earn greater income, which will enable her to improve her way of life and become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy more rice to be sold

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is 38 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Dante owns and operates an agriculture business of copra and making charcoal to earn a living. He has been in this business for over 3 years and earns 30,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2012.

Dante has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional capital for his copra and charcoal business. He wants to have a better future and improve his living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional capital for his copra and charcoal business.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is 28 years old, married, and has a child. Fidel's priority in life is his family's welfare. 

He is a farmer growing rice to sell to traders in their village. He has been in the business for 6 years and earns PHP 10,000 twice a year during harvest season. 

Fidel is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use while farming. It will help nourish his crops and someday lead to a plentiful harvest. Any additional revenue generated will be saved for future family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use while farming.

loans.name: Aminosse

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 7 filhos, todos ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta um neto que vive com ele.
É comerciante e dono do seu próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (peixe, massa, amendoim, arroz, peixe, refrescos, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja construir uma ferragem e fazer crescer a sua actividade comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é investir mais no seu negócio e criar melhores condições de habitabilidade para a sua família.
texts.en: Aminosse is married and is the father of seven children, all of whom go to school.  He lives in his own home and also supports a grandson, who lives with him.  He owns his own business selling various products.  He will use this loan to buy products (fish, pasta, peanuts, rice, fish, soft drinks, etc.) to increase his quantity of merchandise.  In the future, he hopes to build a hardware store and to grow his business.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is to invest more in his business and to create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (fish, pasta, peanuts, rice, soft drinks, etc.).

loans.name: Rufino Jr

texts.en:
Rufino is a hardworking man. He is 46 years old and married; he has three children. He is a farmer who works in his rice field daily from 6am to 5pm. He has been in his farming business for almost eight years and usually earns 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) during each harvest (twice a year). He would like to improve his crop production. To achieve this, he needs additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides that will nourish his crops.  

Someday, profitable harvests will help Rufino's family improve their way of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 2 filhos os quais vivem com a sua mãe, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante, vende produtos alimentares. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (óleo, batata, arroz, açúcar, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja melhorar as condições da sua residência e ampliar o seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é aumentar a fonte de receita para poder realizar todos os seus projectos.
texts.en: Maria is a widow and the mother of two children who live with her mother.  She lives in her own house and doesn't support any additional family members.  She sells food products.  She will use this loan to buy products (oil, potatoes, rice, sugar, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to improve the conditions of her home and to expand her business.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is to increase her source of income to be able to carry out all of her projects.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (oil, potatoes, rice, sugar, etc.).

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 69 years old and married with eleven children. She lives in the Philippines and earns a living by raising pigs. She has been in this business for 13 years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

Nena is borrowing 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional vitamins for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy additional vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lisida Marilu

texts.es: Lisida tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo, vive con su madre y tres hermanas en una colonia que pertenece a la ciudad de Choloma, Cortes. Lisida lleva 4 años de tener una pulpería. Ella vende productos alimenticios como manteca, frijoles, harina, arroz, azúcar y productos de abarrotería. Ha trabajado al lado de su madre desde muy pequeña y creció con la convicción de tener su propio negocio para generar sus propios ingresos. Solicita un segundo préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, manteca, azucar,refrescos, golosinas y otros abarrotes. Para surtir mas su negocio y poder obtener mas ganancias. Su meta es incrementar más sus ingresos para  poner una tiendita mas y mejorar su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Lisida is 23 and a single mother with one son. She lives with her mother and three sisters in a suburb belonging to the city of Choloma, Cortes. Lisida has had a grocery store for four years. She sells food products such as lard, beans, flour, rice, sugar and grocery products. 

She has worked at her mother's side since she was very small and she grew up with the belief that having her own business would allow her to generate her own income. 

She is requesting a second loan of 10,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of food products such as rice, beans, lard, sugar, soda, candy and other groceries, to stock up her business and be able to earn more income.

Her goal is to increase her income further in order to put up another small store and improve her family life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soda, candy, sugar, lard, and other groceries to stock up her grocery store

loans.name: Jenuveva

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos menores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém além dos seus filhos.
É comerciante, vende produtos alimentares. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, óleo, feijão, arroz, açúcar, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio reabrindo um estabelecimento que estava encerrado, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é falta de fundos suficientes e a fraca afluência por parte dos clientes.
texts.en: Jenuveva is married and is the mother of two children who are still minors of age.  She lives in her own home and doesn't support anyone else besides her children.  She will use this loan to buy products (flour, oil, beans, rice, sugar, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business by reopening an establishment that she had closed.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the lack of sufficient funds and the weak turnout of customers.

loans.use: to buy products (flour, oil, beans, rice, sugar, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise).

loans.name: Eda Maria

texts.es: Doña Eda, acompañada de su esposo quien es jubilado, ya sus hijos son independientes, ella ha cumplido con su deber de madre de sacarlos adelante a todos, hoy en día vive y mantiene sus gastos del hogar del alquiler de cuartos en su casa, solicita un tercer crédito a Afodenic y Kiva para cambiar parte del techo y repellar su casa, para esto necesita comprar laminas de zinc, cemento y arena para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, esto no sería posible sin el apoyo de financiamiento por lo que ella está muy agradecida con este programa de crédito.
texts.en:
Eda, together with her husband who is retired and children who are already independent, has done her duty as a mother of getting them all ahead. Today she lives and supports her home expenses by renting out rooms in her home.

She is requesting a third loan from Afodenic and Kiva in order to change part of her roof and plaster her house. In order to do this she needs to buy sheets of zinc, cement and sand in order to improve the conditions of her home. This would not be possible without financial support, which is why she is very thankful for this lending program.

loans.use: to buy sheets of zinc, cement and sand

loans.name: Percina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos, dos quais 3 frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém alem dos seus filhos.
É comerciante, vende produtos alimentares. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, óleo, feijão, açúcar, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio fornecendo farinha a outros estabelecimentos por encomendas, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é manter se saudável e trabalhar mais para atingir os seus objectivos.
texts.en: Percina is married and is the mother of four children, three of whom go to school.  She lives in her own home and doesn't support anyone else besides her children.  She sells food products.  She will use this loan to buy products (flour, oil, beans, sugar, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business by providing flour to other businesses by taking orders.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is maintaining her health so she can work more to reach her objectives.

loans.use: to buy products (flour, oil, beans, sugar, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos, todos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém além dos seus filhos.
É comerciante, vende produtos de primeira necessidade. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, óleo, feijão, amendoim, açúcar, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio e garantir o futuro dos seus filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais para atingir os seus objectivos e formar os seus filhos profissionalmente.
texts.en: Virginia is married and is the mother of five children, all adults.  She lives in her own home and doesn't support anyone else besides her children.  She sells basic goods.  She will use this loan to buy products (flour, oil, beans, peanuts, sugar, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and guarantee the future of her children.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is working more so she can reach her objectives and to shape her children professionally.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (flour, oil, beans, peanuts, sugar, etc.).

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Âgée de 33 ans, Madame Mariam est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle vit avec son époux à Médine-Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de deux ans à cette activité d’achat et de vente d’oignons, au nouveau  marché de Médine où elle dispose d’une  table et où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a deux année. Elle est à son sixième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 35 sacs d’oignons de graines différentes (20 sacs de petites graines et 15 sacs de grosses graines).
 Ses marchandises sont vendues au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement ds femmes de ménages.
Avec ce nouveau prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mariam, aged 33, is married and the mother of three children.  She lives with her husband in Médine-Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

After being involved in several unsuccessful activities, Mariam started to buy and sell onions over two years ago, at the new market in Médine.  She has her own table there and thanks to the quality of her goods, her products are in high demand from her customers. 

In order to meet the needs of an increasing number of customers, Mariam decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago.  She is now on her sixth loan, which will help her to increase her business and to buy 35 bags of onions (20 bags of small-bulb onions and 15 bags of large-bulb onions).

Mariam sells her goods for cash to a customer base which mostly consists of housekeepers.

Thanks to this new loan, Mariam is expecting average monthly profits to reach 80,000 CFA francs, which will be used to contribute to the family expenses and to pay off her loan's interest.  The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 38 years old, is married to a farmer. They are currently residing at the village of Tallungan. She owns and operates a rolling retail store of hair accessories; she sells hair bands, hair clips, pony tail holders, and hair ribbons. She's been in this business for almost four years. Her other source of income is selling vegetables in their village. With her business, she earns a net income of 2,500 PHP a month. She would like a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to purchase hair accessories to sell, such as hair bands, hair clips, pony tail holders, and hair ribbons. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hair accessories such as hair bands, hair clips, pony tail holders, and hair ribbons

loans.name: Katherin Yulieth

texts.es:
Es KATHERIN tiene 22 años, tiene una hija de 5 años se llama juliana  la cual es su vida tiene esposo con el cual llevo 6 años él se llama Sergio vive con la suegra que es una gran ayuda y  ha sido la persona que le ha tendido la mano. Muchas veces estudio en la cruz roja como brigadista con muchos esfuerzos termino  el bachillerato cuando tenía 18 años ya que tuve a la hija a los 17 años ha trabajado desde muy pequeña para pagarse el colegio así que sabe que es sacar plata del bolsillo para costear las cosas que uno quiere y por eso aprendió a valorar las cosas.
Ha trabajado en todo ha sido niñera ha trabajado en jardines como ayudante de preescolar hacia cepillados de cabello a domicilio trabajo vendiendo zapatos, ropa, en restaurantes y todo eso le ayudo a adquirir experiencia y a saber cómo es trabajar.
Quiere terminar  la carrera para poder  brindarle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida y tener un spa propio ser su propia jefe hacer lo que le gusta aunque trabaja en una empresa que no está relacionada con el tema y eso le gusta gracias a ese trabajo pude entrar a estudiar la carrera que siempre ha querido estudiar .
Se considera una persona responsable juiciosa entregada y dedicada a las cosas que hace le pone pasión a todo,  es buena mamá siempre logra lo que se propone y sabe que con esta ayuda  de kiva ahorrara dinero para poder comprar los materiales que exigen la carrera para así poder empezar a ejercerla haciendo masajes a domicilio ya que es una buena forma de empezar a adquirir experiencia, clientela  para así cuando logre realizar su sueño de poner su propio spa tenga de una vez las pacientes listas que son finamente las que me ayudaran a sacar ese sueño adelante…..
Quiere por ultimo agradecerles realmente la oportunidad que están brindando a todas las personas que se vinculan a este convenio entre campoalto y kiva mil y mil gracias por ayudar a las personas que como ella tienen muchos sueños y aspiraciones de mejora para así poder brindarle a sus familias la calidad de vida que se merecen 

MUCHAS GRACIAS …..
texts.en:
This is Katherin, 22.  She has a daughter named Juliana, 5, who is her life.  She has been with her husband, Sergio, for six years.  She lives with her mother-in-law, who's a big help and has given her a hand.  

She studied a lot as a first-aid technician in the Red Cross.  She finished high school with a lot of effort when she was 18, because she had her daughter when she was 17.  She has worked since she was young to pay for school, so she knows what it is to take money out of your pocket to pay for the things you want.  This is why she learned to appreciate things.

She has worked at everything: as a babysitter, in gardens, as a pre-school assistant, brushing hair in the home, selling shoes and clothing, in restaurants.  All this has helped her get experience and know what it is to work.

She wants to finish her program to be able to give her daughter a better quality of life and have her own spa, be her own boss, and do what she likes, although she works in a company that has nothing do do with this.  She likes it because thanks to this job she managed to begin studying the profession she always wanted to.

She considers herself a responsible, sensible, and committed person who's dedicated to the things that make her put passion into everything.  She's a good mother and she always achieves what she sets out to.

She knows that with this help from Kiva she'll save money to be able to buy the materials required by her program so she can begin to practice her profession by giving massages in the home.  It's a good way to begin to get experience and clients.  When she achieves her dream of setting up her own spa she'll have the patients who will help her get ahead with her dream.

Finally, she wants to thank those who are giving an opportunity to all the people connected to this agreement between CampoAlto and Kiva.  Many, many thanks for helping people like herself who have a lot of dreams and goals for improvement so they can give their families the quality of life they deserve.

Thanks a lot!

loans.use: to finish her cosmetology program

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos, apenas 1 frequenta a escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais uma neta que vive com ela.
É comerciante tem um negocio próprio de criação de frangos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (pintos, ração, vitaminas, bebedouros, e outros), para aumentar o volume de produção de frangos.
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio e ser conhecido em toda zona como grande produtor de frangos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais para atingir os seus objectivos.
texts.en: Angelina is married and is the mother of two children, one of whom goes to school.  She lives in her own home and also supports a granddaughter that lives with her.  She has her own business raising chickens.  She will use this loan to buy supplies (chicks, feed, vitamins, water bowls, etc.) to increase her volume of production of chickens.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be known in the area as a big chicken producer.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is working more to reach her objectives.

loans.use: to buy supplies (chicks, feed, vitamins, water bowls, etc.) to increase her volume of production of chickens.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos, apenas 1 frequenta a escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais um neto que vive com ela.
É comerciante, vende produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, amendoim, massa, refrescos, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio diversificando ainda mais aos seus produtos e construir dependências para aluguer, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e iniciar um negócio de criação de gado caprino para revenda.
texts.en: Claudina is married and is the mother of four children, one of whom goes to school.  She lives in her own home and also supports a grandson, who lives with her.  She sells various products.  She will use this loan to buy rice, flour, peanuts, pasta, soft drinks, and other items to increase her quantity of merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and diversify it even more.  She also hopes to build rental units to rent out.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is working more and starting a business of raising livestock to resell.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, flour, peanuts, pasta, soft drinks, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Ahorrar Es Exito Group

texts.es: Buenos días. El grupo “Ahorrar Es Éxito” integrado por 06 socios entusiastas y trabajadores, la cual pasan a su 2do ciclo. Ella es Fortunita de 44 años de edad casada y tiene 04 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual lo realiza a pedidos, ya que por el momento no cuenta con un puesto donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas,  esta actividad le ha permitido generar ingresos para poder apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería de pantalones y chompas para época de invierno. Su mayor deseo es de poner un taller de costura, pues tiene conocimientos de costura. El grupo “Ahorra Es Éxito” está agradecido con la ayuda brindada.  Fortunita es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo marón y pantalón azul.
texts.en:
Good morning. “Ahorrar Es Exito” is made up of 6 enthusiastic and hard working members who are in their 2nd loan cycle. Fortunita is 44 years old.  She is married and has 4 children. She sells clothing for a living and takes orders from her customers since right now she doesn't have a stand from which to sell her clothing. This activity has allowed her to generate an income to help with the household expenses. She will use the loan to buy pants and sweaters for the winter season.  Her dream is to have a seamstress shop because she knows how to sew. 
The group “Ahorrar Es Exito" is grateful for the assistance offered. Fortunita is the first from the left and is wearing the brown shirt and blue pants.

loans.use: purchase pants and sweaters

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.ru: Насимджон трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами, 12 лет назад, он начал свой бизнес услугой таксиста. Благодаря хорошему сервису он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Он хочет развевать свой бизнес дальше, но его машина нуждается в капитальном ремонте. Он затратил все свои деньги для покупки продуктов питания, так как недавно он принимал много гостей. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 доллар США для ремонта автомашины. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nasimjon is a hard-working man. He is married and has three dependent children. His wife is a homemaker and dedicates herself to raising their children. In order to provide for his family, 12 years ago  Nasimjon his business providing taxi services. Thanks to his good service he has a loyal customer following. He would like to develop his business further, but his car needs major repairs. He has spent all his money buying food as recently he had to take care of many guests. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,500 USD to repair his car. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El señor Virgilio de 65  años de edad,  no tiene hijo que dependen de él, vive solo con su esposa, en casa propia, vive en una comunidad de  San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Don Virgilio se dedica desde hace 15 años  al negocio de venta de frescos y dulces, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que tiene pulpería ya que vende este producto al por mayor y al detalle.
Don Virgilio es una persona trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de frescos, churros, dulces y agua en fardos, con el apoyo de este préstamo espera que sus ingresos mejoren y por ende su mejore un poco su calidad de vida.
Don Virgilio su sueño es mejorar su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013
texts.en:
Virgilio is 65 years old. He doesn't have any dependent children and lives alone with his wife in their own home. He lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.
Virgilio has been selling soft drinks and sweets for 15 years. His friends and small store owners are his customers since he sells his products wholesale and retail.
Virgilio is a hard working person who wants to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, churros, sweets and bottled water in bundles.  He hopes the loan will help him increase his income and improve his quality of life.
His dream is to improve his business.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – March 2013

loans.use: purchase soft drinks, churros, sweets and bottled water for his business.

loans.name: Blanca Nuriz

texts.es:
La joven Blanca es una muy buena persona, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora vive con  su esposo y sus  hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. 
Blanca su negocio es  compra y venta de ganado, el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de ganado  o reses.  Con el crédito espera  el aumento de las ventas debido a que contara con más mercancía  que ofrecer a los clientes. 
Blanca espera cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo desea que su situación y la de su familia mejoren con esta inversión. 
Blanca espera  que en 2 años  su negocio este posicionado como  el negocio  más grande y  reconocido de su caserío y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos en los estudios para que se conviertan en personas de bien.



Choluteca, Honduras – Marzo  del   2013
texts.en: Blanca is an enterprising, responsible and hardworking young woman who lives with her husband and their children in a community in southern Honduras. She makes a living buying and selling livestock and is requesting the loan to purchase cattle and other livestock. She hopes the loan will increase her sales as she has more merchandise to offer customers. She expects to meet her needs as well as improve her and her family's situation with this investment. Blanca hopes that in two years her business will be the biggest and most recognizable in the town and she will be able to support her children's education so they become good people.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol is 49 years old and married with two grown up children. She cultivates one and a half hectares of farmland in Kompong Speu, Cambodia. She has been farming rice for more than 20 years with the support of her husband. To add more to their income, Pol’s husband is involved in a recycling business. Other sources of the family’s income are generated by their two children; her daughter is employed as a garment worker and her son is a security guard.

Pol would like to acquire a loan through HKL to invest in purchasing gold jewelry. She can save money this way and she will sell it when the price of gold goes up in the future. Plus, it will be used for personal decoration on some special occasions like at wedding parties, religious ceremonies and other special times. Through having valued jewelry, Pol is building a good reputation and shows other people that her living condition is improving.
She hopes lenders will give her the loan and she promises to pay it back punctually as scheduled.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing gold jewelry.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Celsa requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Celsa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazardous risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Jenni Roxana

texts.es:
Jenni es una mujer joven de 21 años de edad casada, con muchas fuerzas, con muchos sueños y madre de 1 hijo el cual vive con ella y junto a su esposo se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de granos básicos (arroz, maíz y frijol). Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completado el cual pudo cursar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio gracias al apoyo de sus padres los cuales le enseñaron dicha actividad la cual es ejercida desde hace muchos años y viene de generación en generación siendo esta medio de sustento e ingresos para su familia y que hasta hoy en día sigue practicando. El terreno que ellos cultiva es alquilado y gracias a una sus suegros la casa en la que ellos habitan es una herencia por parte de los padres de su conyugue. La tierra que ellos trabajan está ubicada a 4 kilómetros de distancia de donde ellos habitan y se trasladan a pie o en bicicleta diariamente. Su producto es comercializado y vendido por los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la comunidad para su adquisición.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante y abono para sus cultivos los cuales permitirá mantener limpio de plagas y de enfermedades los cuales destruyen cultivos completos de no ser tratados a tiempo.

Su sueño es poder tener sus propias tierras las cuales pueda trabajar de manera propia sin tener que pagar alquiler ya que esto vendrá a dar las ganancias propias y en un 100% para poder seguir trabajando y darle un mejor futuro a su familia e hijo.
texts.en: Jenni is a married young woman of 21. With a lot of hard work and a lot of dreams this mother of one son makes a living planting and growing basic grains (rice, corn and beans). She graduated from school with a lot of effort and sacrifice thanks to the support of her parents, who taught her about farming for many years, since it has been the family's livelihood for generations and still is to this day. Jenni and her family rent the land they cultivate, and her house was inherited from her husband's parents. The land they work on is four kilometers from where they live, and they go either by foot or by bike every day. Jenni sells her products to the different intermediaries who come to the community to acquire goods. She is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizers and manure for her crops so they stay free of plagues and diseases that can destroy entire harvests if they are not treated in time. Jenni's dream is to be able to have her own land so she can work on her own without having to pay rent and so her profits will be 100 percent hers and she can continue working to give a better future to her family and her son.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Amparo Dicenia

texts.es:
La  señora  Amparo es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo sus 4 hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la pulpería. 
Doña Amparo el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, refrescos, carne, café, azúcar,  frijoles, quesos, leche, azúcar, café,  huevos,  jabones y pan. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercadería  que ofrecer y poder así atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Doña Amparo espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona.
Doña Amparo espera seguir trabajando y poder  apoyar siempre a  sus hijos a que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades. 	



Choluteca, Honduras  –  Marzo  del   2013
texts.en: Amparo is a responsible, hardworking and honest woman who lives with her husband and their four children in southern Honduras. Her business is a convenience store, and she is requesting the loan to purchase corn, beverages, meat, coffee, sugar, beans, cheeses, milk, eggs, soaps and bread. With the loan, she hopes to increase her sales by offering more merchandise, and in this way she'll be able to better serve her customers. Amparo hopes to meet her needs and improve her family's quality of life a little. In a few years she hopes that her business keeps growing and becomes one of the biggest and most recognizable in the area. Amparo hopes to keep working and to always be able to support her children so they become good people with better opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beverages, meat, coffee, sugar, beans, cheeses, milk, eggs, soaps and bread.

loans.name: 25 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE OCTUBRE”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Faustina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de refrescos, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, venta de abarrotes, venta de comida, elaboración de frituras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Faustina es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de crédito de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de frituras; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, quien anteriormente vendía estos productos posteriormente ella decide implementarlo y tener su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por quintal) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y los ahorros porque dan buenas recomendaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank “25 DE OCTUBRE” is starting their fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer through the regional office in Cascada. The group is made up of twelve members and is directed by a board of directors with Faustina as its president. The members engage in various types of businesses such as soft drinks sales, clothing sales, neighborhood store, cosmetics sales, grocery sales, food sales and fried food production.

The loan they are requesting will help small businesses like Faustina’s.  She says that she was invited to join by one of Pro Mujer’s loan officers who visited her at home. She has been a member for six months. She currently has a business making fried foods.  She says she learned this business from her mother who used to sell these products and later on, decided to start her own business. 

She will use the loan to increase her capital by buying potatoes by the quintal that she will purchase wholesale at the markets in the city of El Alto. She will then cook them and sell them from her place of business. This work allows her to generate resources to maintain her household as she is married and has a daughter. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training sessions on health and savings because they have given her good advice.

loans.use: purchase potatoes by the quintal.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 35 years old and married with 1 child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a food vending business in the local community to earn a living. She has operated her business for over 2 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC this year and she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional food to sell such as meat and soft drinks. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as meat and soft drinks

loans.name: Edze

texts.en:
Edze is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like milk, sugar, noodles, egg, soft drinks, etc. for her general store.

Edze has operated this business for 8 years.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like milk, sugar, noodles, egg, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Danny

texts.en: Danny is 39 years old and married with 2 children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns farmland, planting and harvesting rice. He has been in this business for over 5 years and earns 7,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2012, and now he has requested a loan of 9,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. His hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve his living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 41 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Chona is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other materials for pig pen repair.

Chona has been raising pigs for 23 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other materials for pig pen repair

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is a 50 years old mother who was engages in vegetable vending to supplement her husband income. She aims to make the business profitable in order to generate sufficient income to satisfy their necessities and save money for future emergencies. She plans to acquire more kinds of vegetables to sell but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional capital of PHP 20,000.00 to buy okra, egg plant, tomatoes, string beans, pechay, cabbage and bitter melon to sell. Through this financial assistance, she is hoping that someday, she will make the business viable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy okra, egg plant, tomatoes, string beans, pechay, cabbage and bitter melon to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase pigs to resell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Beverly works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Beverly is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to  purchase more clothing to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business.

Beverly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is 51 years old and married to Reynante, a farmer. They also have children to support. Violeta helps her spouse to plant and harvest rice to sell. They also hire laborers who help them in the rice field. She usually earns about 15,000 PHP during harvest which occurs twice a year. Her earnings are used for meals and educational expenses. She hopes to increase her farming output which is why she is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to pay for labor and to buy farming inputs including fertilizers and insecticides. It will help improve crop production and increase Violeta's income which will lead to the family's financial stability.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy farming inputs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 69 years old and married with eight children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like noodles, spices, bread, etc..

Editha has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Editha aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like noodles, spices, bread, etc.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, de 50 años de edad , esta casado con Ceferina, su pareja y madre de sus hijos aunque ahora solo vive con Alcides de 24 años en la casa propia que construyeron hace muchos años , ubicada en un anexo agrícola.
Pedro es un hombre responsable y trabajador. Desde joven le gustó el trabajo de campo, por eso hasta ahora se dedica a las labores agrícolas. “Siembro papas, maíz, arvejas, habas, flores de gladiolos, y otros; crece de todo aquí”, menciona orgulloso. En sus más de 25 años de trabajo ha conseguido muchas satisfacciones y frustraciones, pero afirma que todas esas experiencias lo ayudan en su crecimiento como emprendedor. Dice que la siembra de todos sus productos son rentables, solo depende de cultivarlos en meses específicos para cosecharlos cuando los precios sean buenos. Ahora cuenta con terrenos propios , ya que antes tenía que alquilarlos.En sus planes próximos están el cultivar arvejas y maíz, por eso solicita de su apoyo. Pedro, invertirá los S/.3800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríós .
texts.en:
Pedro, is 50 years old, married to Ceferina (his partner and mother of his children even though he currently lives with Alcides, who is 24 years old, in a home they built many years back, located in an agricultural area.)
Pedro is a responsible and hardworking man. He has liked working in the fields since he was young which is why he is still dedicated to it now. "I plant potatoes, corn, peas, beans, gladioli flowers, etc. I grow all sorts of things here," he proudly mentions. In his more than 25 years of work he has gained much satisfaction and frustrations, but he assures that all of his experiences have helped him grow as an entrepreneur. He says the crops are very profitable. He just needs to cultivate them during certain months to harvest when prices are best. He now has his own land as before he had to rent it. His next plans include growing peas and corn which is why he is requesting a loan. Pedro will use the 3800 Peruvian soles loan to buy organic fertilizer to nourish his crops.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, tiene 64 años de edad, es casado, tiene 11 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Don Samuel siempre se ha dedicado  a la agricultura de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles, hace 12 años implemento otro cultivo que es la producción de yuca. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha decidido por solicitar otro préstamo por 8,000 Lempiras, siendo este el quinto ciclo. Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para el cultivo de yuca y pago de mano de obra para darle mantenimiento al mismo cultivo. Su objetivo es ampliar el cultivo y sacar mejor cosecha. Tiene como plan mejorar la producción para ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en: Samuel is 64 years old, married and has 11 children. He lives in a small town in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. He has always made a living in agriculture, growing basic grains like corn and beans. Twelve years ago he started growing another crop, yucca. He sells his goods at the local market. He decided to request his fifth loan cycle, which he plans to use to purchase fertilizers and manure for his yucca crops and to pay for labor to care for them. His goal is to expand his production and take in a better harvest so he can help his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure, and to pay for labor to clean his yucca, corn and bean crops.

loans.name: G.s El Aterrizaje Group

texts.es:
El señor Oscar es una persona muy trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de leña y golosinas desde hace 5 años.
Don Oscar vende desde su casa de habitación y  de manera ambulante en su comunidad y demás caseríos cercanos a esta.  Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como ser: carne de res, repollo, papas, plátanos verdes, pollo, refrescos, yuca, lechuga, arroz, etc.
Don Oscar espera que gracias al préstamo las ventas aumenten, le servirá de mucho porque así contara con más insumos que son necesarios para seguir elaborando su producto.
Don Oscar al igual que sus compañeros de grupo esperan hacer crecer sus negocios y que les genere ganancias que les permitan mejorar un poco sus calidades s de vida y las de sus familias. 
Don Oscar su sueño es q su negocio sea uno de los más reconocidos de la comunidad y con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos continúen con los estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mayores oportunidades en la vida. 
Doña María tiene 51 años, su negocio es una mini pulpería desde hace 10 años.
Angélica tiene 27 años, su negocio es la venta de refrescos y más desde hace 3 años.



Choluteca, Honduras – Marzo 2013
texts.en: Oscar is a very hardworking man who lives in a community in southern Honduras along with his wife and their two children. He has had a business selling firewood and snacks for the past five years. Oscar sells the items from his home and around his community and other nearby villages. He is requesting the loan to purchase more supplies like beef, cabbage, potatoes, green bananas, chicken, beverages, yucca, lettuce, rice and other items. Oscar hopes that thanks to this loan his sales will increase and will help him out a lot so he can buy more ingredients necessary to keep making his snacks. Oscar and his fellow group members hope to grow their businesses so they can earn a little bit more income and improve the quality of life for themselves and their families a little bit. Oscar's dream is for his business to be one of the best known in the community, and in this way he will be able to continue supporting his family so his children can stay in school and become good people with better opportunities in life. María is 51 years old and has had a small convenience store for the past 10 years. Angélica is 27 years old and has had a business selling refreshments for more than three years.

loans.use: to purchase beef, cabbage, potatoes, green bananas, chicken, beverages, yucca, lettuce, rice and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and spraying equipment for her coffee crops.

loans.name: 5 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “5 DE ABRIL”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de anticucho, tienda de barrio, venta de revistas, venta de juguetes, venta de CD’s, venta de comida, venta de juegos recreativos, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Eugenia da a conocer que este es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de revistas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace quince años atrás, actualmente es el negocio de sustento de su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de revistas) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The A.C. "April 5th," will be starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the Senkata Focal Center. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board of directors where Mrs. María Eugenia is the president. The businesses of the communal association members are varied including: pea sales, a neighborhood store, magazine sales, toy sales, CD sales, recreational toy sales, and clothing sales. 

The loan will help the small businesses. Mrs. María Eugenia shared that this is the second cycle with Pro Mujer, admitted by an institution's promoter that visited them at their homes. At the moment, she has a business where she sells magazines. She shares that she started this business on her own 15 years ago and this business is currently her family's income.

The loan will be used to increase merchandise (purchase of magazines) bought from wholesale sellers in La Paz city and afterwards will sell in her locale. This business helps her have an income to maintain her home and support her two children since she live in a common-law marriage.

When she is asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health training and loans.

loans.use: buy magazines

loans.name: Mari Luz

texts.es: Mari Luz, de 37 años de edad , está casada y tiene 02 hijos con quienes vive en una casa construida hace algunos años , la cual está ubicada en un anexo agrícola.Mari Luz es una mujer de principios y de actitud luchadora para el trabajo. Desde los 17 años trabaja como agricultora en terrenos que heredó de sus padres. En ellos produce arvejas, habas, papas, maíz y flores de diversos colores. “Me gusta trabajar en el campo, a mi esposo también, los 2 nos dividimos las tareas”, menciona. Además dice que, la venta de arvejas estos días es  buena porque el precio del saco subió de 90 a 120 soles. Con ese dinero podrá comprar más semillas de otros productos, ya que las lluvias empezaron y quiere aprovecharlas al máximo. Mari Luz ya empezó con la siembra de papas, por eso también se esmerará en sus cuidados.Tiene como meta adquirir más semillas y fertilizantes para sembrar arvejas y papas , por eso requiere de se apoyo.Mari Luz, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos , además agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Mari Luz, 37 years old, is married and has two children who live in with her in a house built a few years ago. Her house is connected to an agricultural shop. Mari Luz is a woman with principles and a fighting attitude toward her work. Since she was 17 years old, Mari Luz has worked farming some land she inherited from her parents. She grows peas, beans, corn and various flowers. She mentions, "I enjoy working in the fields, so does my husband; we both split the work."

Mari Luz also mentions that pea sales have been very good recently because prices rose from 90 to 120 soles per bag. With this money, Mari Luz would be able to buy more seeds of other crops. She hopes to take full advantage of the the coming rainy season. Mari Luz began growing potatoes and will also be taking care of those plants. 

Her goal is to acquire more seeds and fertilizers in order to grow peas and potatoes. That is why she needs this loan. Mari Luz will invest the 3000 soles to buy organic fertilizer for her crops. She is very grateful for this loan and pledges to punctually make all of her repayments.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy, de 45 años de edad es una mujer soltera. Cuidó sola de sus 7 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 4 de ellos, en la casa que adquirió hace algunos años.Su principal actividad económica se centra en el cuidado de sus animales como: pollos y cuyes, los cuales comercializa a buen precio ya que posee un número considerable de ellos. Además de aprovechar el tiempo que pasa en su casa, para fabricar leña el cual vende a las saunas, quienes ya la conocen y constantemente le realizan pedidos. Trabaja sin descanso, pues tiene que mantener por si sola a sus hijos. Por eso en las mañanas trabaja en una casa, limpiando. “Soy reina de la limpieza”, comenta muy alegre. Todos estos trabajos la mantienen ocupada y con la firme idea de progresar para ver a sus hijos profesionales .Edy, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de más materiales para la construcción de los galpones para los pollos y cuyes, ya que este último año aumentó considerablemente.
texts.en: Edy is a 45 year old single mother who raised her seven children, of whom four are still living, in the house which she acquired a few years ago. Her primary source of income is raising animals such as chickens and guinea pigs, which she sells at a good price as she has a considerable amount of them. In addition to passing time in her home, she cuts firewood which she sells to the saunas who already know her and are always placing orders. She works without rest, as she alone must look after all her children. To do so she works in the mornings cleaning a home. "I am the queen of cleaning," she happily notes. All these jobs keep her busy and the conviction to persevere to one day see her children become professionals. Edy will invest the S/.1,500 soles to purchase construction materials for building coops for the chickens and guinea pigs, as this last year their numbers increased considerably.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for the coop for the chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, es casado y tiene un hijo que está en etapa escolar, vive en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa está ubicada en la zona  Bella vista de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente Juan trabaja por más de diez horas como chofer ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia, porque su esposa gana muy poco como empleada de limpieza en casas particulares.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehículo, ya que es su fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Juan es construir más habitaciones para dar comodidad y seguridad a su familia.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan is married and has a son who is in grade school, and they live in a their own two bedroom home. The house is located in the Bella Vista district of the city of La Paz. Currently Juan works more than 10 hours a day as a driver, as he must cover the costs of food, school, and basic services for his family. His wife earns very little as a maid in private residences. 

The loan is needed to cover the costs of maintenance for Juan's vehicle, as it is the primary source of income for his family. Juan's dream is to build additional rooms for his house in order to provide for the comfort and security of his family. This is Juan's first loan working with IMPRO, as well as his first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of maintaining his taxi.

loans.name: G.s Cedeño #5 Group

texts.es:
La Señora Nery es una persona muy trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Su negocio es la compra y venta de mariscos desde hace 10 años.
Doña Nery sale a vender de casa en casa en su comunidad y demás caseríos cercanos a esta, necesita el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: Babosa, camarón, pancha, wiche, corvina, etc. los cuales necesita para cubrir la fuerte demanda que tiene y así satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. 
Doña Nery al igual que sus compañeros de Grupo esperan que el préstamo les sirva de mucho ya que no cuentan con los productos necesarios para cubrir la demanda que tiene de sus clientes.
Doña Nery espera que sus ventas aumenten y con esto ganar más ingresos que le mejoren un poco su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Doña Nery sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y que sea el mas reconocido de la zona y gracias a esto seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida. 
Don Carlos tiene 32 años, se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 10 años.
Gloria tiene 23 años, su negocio es la vente de conservas desde hace 5 años. 




Choluteca, Honduras – Marzo 2013
texts.en:
Nery is a hardworking woman who lives in a southern community in Honduras with her husband and their four children. She has worked buying and selling seafood for the last 10 years. She sells her products door to door in her community, including at nearby farmhouses. She needs this loan in order to buy products such as escargot, shrimp, salted nuts, sandwiches, sea bass, etc. She needs these items to satisfy demand from her customers. 

Nery, just like her group members, hope that this loan will help them to acquire the items they need in their businesses. Nery hopes to increase her sales and turn a higher profit to help improve the quality of life of her family. Nery dreams of growing her business, and of it becoming the best-known throughout the region. This will help her to support her children as they continue studying so they have more opportunities in life. 

Carlos is 32 years old. He has been selling artisanal fishes for 10 years. 
Gloria is 23 years old. She has been selling canned goods for the last five years. 

Choluteca, Honduras – March 2013

loans.use: to buy escargot, shrimp, salted nuts, sandwiches, sea bass, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Doña Marta de 43 años de edad vende ropa ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que vende logra sacar para los gastos de su hogar y para lo que sus hijos necesiten vive con su esposo quien tambien le ayuda con los gastos y con sus 2 hijos en casa propia, Doña Marta solicta un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi obtener mas ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marta is 43 years old and has worked as a street vendor selling clothing for several years. With what she makes in sales she is able to cover the costs of her household and provide for her children's needs. She lives together with her husband, who also works, and her two children in a private residence. Marta is requesting a loan in order to purchase more merchandise, which will allow her to earn more so she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Elien

texts.en:
Elien is 51 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elien has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. Elien requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

Elien has been in this business for four years. In the future, Elien would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 42 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business of copra (coconut product) production to earn a living. She has been in business for over three years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and now has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for copra production.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for copra production

loans.name: Reydo

texts.es: Reydo, de 43 años de edad , esta casado con Ana, con quien tiene 3 hijos: Fermín, Mariluz y Jackelyn. Todos ellos viven en una casa rústica que Reydo construyó con ayuda de sus familiares la cual se ubica en un distrito agrícola.Reydo se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niño. Manifiesta que ayudaba a sus padres en los cultivos de sus terrenos, desde entonces le agrado esa actividad. Por eso ahora, se encarga de cuidar sus sembríos de papas, maíz, arvejas y flores de gladiolos. Trabaja contento en el campo, al lado de su esposa. Además cuenta con animales de carga que le sirven mucho para esta actividad. “Éste mes estoy recogiendo las flores de gladiolos, y los precios son buenos, por las fiestas religiosas”, cuenta. En sus planes está empezar 2 siembras, una de arvejas y otra de maíz, ya que las lluvias empezaron y quiere aprovecharlas al máximo. Solicita de su apoyo para lograr sus objetivos. Reydo, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Reydo, 43 years old, is married to Ana, with whom he has three children: Fermín, Mariluz, and Jackelyn. They live in a rustic house that Reydo built with the help of some family members. Their house is located in a farming district.

Reydo has made a living farming since he was a boy. He used to help his parents cultivate their land, an experience is is thankful to have had. Reydo takes care of his potato, corn, peas, and gladiola flowers. He is very happy growing these crops alongside his wife. They also take care of animals that help them work their land. 

"This month, I am gathering gladiola flowers. The market price is good because of the upcoming religious festivals," he says. Reydo plans to start two more crops, one of peas and one of corn, in order to take advantage of the coming rainy season. 

Reydo is requesting this loan in order to achieve his goals. He will invest the 2500 soles to buy organic fertilizer for his plants. Reydo pledges to make all his repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is aged 51. He sells various merchandise and has been in the business for one year. He is married with seven children, three of them are still pursuing high school education while four have completed school. His wife is a farmer. He has requested a loan to add more items such as lotions, soaps, salt, and cooking oil for sale. He plans to use the profits to set up a shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is 50 years old and married with three children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in business for over five years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and now has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. His hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires for him motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 52 years old, married and has two children, one in school.

Felomina is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Felomina requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to pay the laborer's salary for the cultivation of land.

Felomina has been farming sugarcane for 11 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Felomina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to pay the laborer's salary for the cultavation of land

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 48 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana production farm to earn a living. She has been in business for over five years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008 and now has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her business every day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Adiel

texts.en: Adiel is 29-years-old. He sells clothes and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, he wants to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en: Dionisia is a 42-year-old mother who aims to be successful in life. She was gifted with a child and they live happily in a rural community. To achieve her goals, she helps her husband in gaining income for the sake of their family. She engages in buying and selling vegetables while her husband cultivates their farm land. She wants to improve her business to increase her income, but is unable to because of inadequate capital. She is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions, garlic, cabbages, potatoes and sweet potatoes to sell. Being a hard working mother, she believes that she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions, garlic, cabbages, potatoes and sweet potatoes to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Poblacion, North, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Cherie Ann

texts.en:
Cherie Ann is a 39-year-old single mom of one child. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been in this business for four months and earns about 35,000 PHP a month doing so.
Recently Cherie Ann joined GDMPC. She is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan that she will use to buy the ingredients needed to make the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 29 years old, married with 2 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a snack food vending stand in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 3 years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. Now she has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients to make sticky rice for snacks. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improves her living situations.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make sticky rice for snacks.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita works hard to support her family. Florita is widow and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.
Florita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional threads, needles and other tailoring materials needed for her business.
Florita has been in this business for 30 years now.
In the future, Florita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional threads, needles and other tailoring materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 50 years old, married to a farmer, and blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 16 years. With this business she's earning a net income of PHP 5,000 weekly. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 35,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, milk, biscuits, noodles, bread, canned goods and beverages. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sugar, milk, biscuits, noodles, bread, canned goods and beverages for her general store.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 48-year-old diligent and hardworking women, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Three of her children are currently studying at school and two are working. Her husband has died, making Parveen a widow and left to manage all of the household expenses alone. One of her sons is laborer and he needs new tools for his construction work. Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can buy new tools like a hammer, nails, drill machine, etc. The old tools are obsolete and he needs these new tools to continue his work. She is very hopeful that the loan would be productive one for them and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to buy new tools for her son.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is a 28-year-old hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and three children. Only one her son is currently going to school, as she is unable to afford educational expenses for all her children. Her husband is working in a textile company but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.
